{"corpusName":"wiley","keywords":{"teeft":["levinas","levinasian","mauritian","surya","ouma","levinasian teaching","mauritian saga","elle","mauritius","totalite","cette","suis","burggraeve","ananta","mariam","chercheur","quarantaine","marro","sandford","eudes","emmanuel levinas","flat island","summons","ethical encounter","medical study","alexis","same time","levinasian term","sans","avec","absolute other","male protagonist","erotic intimacy","aunt catherine","jean eudes","marie anne","solitude","karen","protagonist","feminine","jacques derrida","discreet welcome","silent presence","welcome set","woman scholar","ethical dimension","daringly concretize","levinasian feminine","female character","identity construction","absolute alterity","ethical relation","langage sans enseignement","langage silencieux","entente sans","visage indiscret","male language","levinasian solitude","everyday life","levinasian same","alexis return","family domain","long last","central section","colonial system","immigrant worker","many way","military service obligation","early year","indian family","little money","levinasian trace","small goodness","stanford university press","propos recueillis","magazine february","martinus nijho","duquesne university press","patrick modiano"]},"author":[{"name":"Karen D. Levy","affiliations":["University of Tennessee"]}],"articleId":["OLI875"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-9B8Q03SC-K","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"As Jacques Derrida emphasizes in his eloquent funeral tribute to Emmanuel Levinas, \u201cwelcome\u201d is one of the most frequently used words in Totalit\u00e9 et infini. In the early pages of this work Levinas insists on the broadly framed significance of welcoming and teaching as manifestations of the ethical encounter. In later sections, however, he carefully distinguishes between the discreet welcome of the feminine whose language is silent and without teaching, and the approach of an absolute Other, who teaches transcendence itself. Levinas privileges the masculine when referring to the Other who teaches and seems to relegate the feminine to a silent presence whose welcome sets the stage for the ethical experience but who lacks the capacity to accept this challenge. The role and status of sexual difference in relation to the ethical is perhaps the most highly contested aspect of Levinas's writings, and since the late 1980s women scholars have ever more boldly probed the tensions in Levinas's writings with respect to these issues. Their commentaries, written from a variety of perspectives, force us to acknowledge Levinas's shortcomings. At the same time they enable us to appreciate more specifically the significance of Le Cl\u00e9zio's own undertaking, which changed form dramatically following his years with the Indians in Panama to assume an openly acknowledged ethical dimension. The works from the last two decades that most daringly concretize the process of refusing or accepting the summons of an Other are the Mauritian sagas of Le chercheur d'or, La quarantaine, and R\u00e9volutions. These works both valorize the welcome of the Levinasian feminine and embody teaching in female characters, such as Ouma, Suryavati, Ananta, Anna Archambeau, and Catherine Marro. The male protagonists in these works, Alexis L'\u00c9tang, L\u00e9on Archambeau, and Jean Marro, either reject their teaching outright, preferring to remain enclosed in the solitude of the Same, or in different ways, accept the possibility of re\u2010commencement as Other, which Le Cl\u00e9zio himself so eagerly embraced.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":88,"sectionCount":4,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":4}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":19,"tableCount":0,"refCount":21},"tdmReady":true,"score":8,"pdfWordCount":10964,"pdfCharCount":56351,"pdfVersion":1.3,"pdfPageCount":26,"pdfPageSize":"430.866 x 649.134 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":422,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":321,"abstractCharCount":2076,"keywordCount":0},"title":"To Approach, to Welcome, to Contest","hasFormula":false,"genre":["article"],"host":{"title":"Orbis Litterarum","language":["unknown"],"doi":["10.1111/(ISSN)1600-0730"],"issn":["0105-7510"],"eissn":["1600-0730"],"publisherId":["OLI"],"volume":"61","issue":"6","pages":{"first":"488","last":"513","total":"26"},"genre":["journal"]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"date":["late 1980s","early 1970s","1918","1998","1891","1995","mid- 1950s","1798","1980"],"orgName":["Polytechnic Institute of Tlateloco"],"persName":["I. Sport & Culture (Universit\u00e9 Paris X) et GSPR (EHESS"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Computer Programs"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Prosp\u00e9ro"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Analysis of Corpora"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Coding"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Interpretation"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Proximity"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Sociology"}],"articleId":["10.1177_075910630508500102"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isOpenAccess","value":"greenOpenAccess"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/M70-LTG1GV9M-8","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"The Program Prosp\u00e9ro Tried Out Against A Corpus of Sociological Abstracts: The objective of this article is to test the potential of the program, Prosp\u00e9ro, for analyzing the abstracts of the first congress of the French Sociological Association (AFS). Prosp\u00e9ro was conceived as a program for the analysis of corpora of texts characterized by a certain variability (particularly in the use of argumentation and time). We consider these abstracts as a \u201cdossier; that is, as a collection of texts characterized by the unknowns and the obligations of authors proposing a presentation in a Thematic Network (TN) session. To begin with, we show how much receding \u2013 done by the researcher in the case of Prosp\u00e9ro \u2013 is decisive in determining the level of analysis and of hypothesis testing. We then propose a model describing the expectations of a potential presenter and construct categories, collections and fictitious entities to test this model. The program, in this context, functions as an instrument for identifying singular properties of the corpus (for example, judging the usefullness of a category or a collection in characterizing a TN). But it also identifies atypical texts which can encourage the modification of the model. Finally, we study how presenters adapt to the requirements of a proximity between the abstract and the call for papers distributed by the TNs. This approach shows that only a few TNs bring together texts sharing similar characteristics. This work permits us to identify certain interesting aspects of French sociology and, in particular, the possibilities and the limits of Prosp\u00e9ro. The program functions as a research tool which can test a researcher's interpretations, hypotheses and models. The program would be even more useful if corpora could be complemented by texts permitting a variation (particularly historic) which would benefit the analysis of sociological scientific production.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":25,"sectionCount":8,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":8,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":5,"tableCount":7,"refCount":33},"tdmReady":true,"score":10,"pdfWordCount":15978,"pdfCharCount":77191,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":34,"pdfPageSize":"372.48 x 597.6 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":470,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":300,"abstractCharCount":1925,"keywordCount":7},"title":"Le Logiciel Prospero A L'Epreuve D'Un Corpus De Resumes Sociologiques","hasFormula":true,"refBibs":[{"host":{"pages":{"first":"38"},"title":"Bulletin de Method%gie So ciologique (59 ruc Pouchet , F 75017 Paris)","publicationDate":"2005"}},{"host":{"volume":"4","title":"Tableau"},"title":"Representants de la collection NOTIONS-SOCIOLOGIQUES acteurs (306) ; L\u2019analyse ph\u00e9nom\u00e9nologique interpr\u00e9tative est fond\u00e9e sur une herm\u00e9neutique ph\u00e9nom\u00e9nologique\u00a0: l\u2019\u00e9tude approfondie de la mise en sens d\u2019une exp\u00e9rience subjective par un individu. Cette m\u00e9thode est interpr\u00e9tative dans la mesure o\u00f9 le chercheur interroge, critique et organise cette mise en sens, notamment en la confrontant \u00e0 la litt\u00e9rature existante. Ancrage constant dans les donn\u00e9es, standardisation de la m\u00e9thode et double cotation permettent de garantir la rigueur du processus. Nous adoptons dans cet article une d\u00e9marche idiographique (\u00e9tude de cas approfondie) caract\u00e9ristique de l\u2019IPA\u00a0; cette analyse est appliqu\u00e9e au cas d\u2019une femme accompagnant son conjoint atteint de cancer en fin de vie. Les r\u00e9sultats obtenus renseignent sur le fonctionnement psychique de l\u2019individu confront\u00e9 \u00e0 la perspective de la mort \u00e0 venir d\u2019un proche et donnent des outils de r\u00e9flexion quant \u00e0 la pr\u00e9vention de la d\u00e9tresse psychique dans le champ du behavior","academy ofmanagement review","operation research","science administrative","organizational research","organization theory","rapport"]},"author":[{"name":"Richard D\u00e9ry","affiliations":["\u00e9cole des Hautes \u00e9tudes Commerciales, Montr\u00e9al","*\u00e9cole des Hautes \u00e9tudes Commerciales, Service de l'enseignement de l'administration et des ressources humaines, 5255, avenue Decelles, Montr\u00e9al (Qu\u00e9bec) H3T 1V6."]}],"articleId":["CJAS1"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-M1NGSD1B-B","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"R\u00e9sum\u00e9: Le mod\u00e8le orthodoxe de la science est, pour l'essentiel, le seul discours \u00e9pist\u00e9mologique tenu dans le champ des sciences de l'administration jusqu'\u00e0 la fin des ann\u00e9es 70. La r\u00e9flexion \u00e9pist\u00e9mologique ne consiste alors qu'en une transposition du discours formel et normatif des tenants du processus formel de la production des connaissances scientifiques au cas des sciences de l'administration. Depuis la fin des ann\u00e9es 70, plusieurs membres du champ contestent la pertinence du mo\u00e8le orthodoxe. Toutefois, si les r\u00e9centes recherches \u00e9pist\u00e9mologiques s'inscrivent bien dans la tendance, constat\u00e9e en \u00e9pist\u00e9mologie, d'un rejet du mod\u00e8le orthodoxe de la science, elles ne retiennent pas celle qui a accompagn\u00e9 et permis ce rejet, \u00e0 savoir l'\u00e9tude de processus concrets de production de connaissances. D\u00e8s lors, ces recherches sont partielles et pr\u011btent \u00e0 la critique puisqu'elles traitent d'une mani\u00e9re th\u00e9orique la constitution des sciences de l'administration, alors que les options \u00e9pist\u00e9mologiques quiy sont prises commandent pr\u00e9cis\u00e9ment l'\u00e9tude de processus concrets. Il semble donc n\u00e9cessaire d'entreprendre la contestation du mod\u00e8le orthodoxe des sciences de l'administration par une d\u00e9marche empirique. \u00c0 la lumi\u00e9re des \u00e9veloppements du champ contemporain de l'\u00e9pist\u00e9mologie, il est clair que ce n'est qu'en s'inscrivant dans une telle d\u00e9marche que l'\u00e9pist\u00e9mologie des sciences de l'administration peut se d\u00e8velopper d'une mani\u00e8re pertinente. Abstract: Until the end of the 70s, the orthodox model of science was essentially the only epistemological discourse held in the field of administrative sciences. In this field, epistemological thought consisted simply of a transposition of the formal and normative discourse of supporters of the formal process of scientific knowledge production. Since the end of the 70s, many members of the field have contested the orthodox model's pertinence. Nevertheless, while recent epistemological research fits in with the tendency noted in epistemology to reject the orthodox model of science, it is not part of the tendency which accompanied and permitted this rejection, namely the study of the concrete processes of knowledge production. That being the case, this research is partial and open to criticism, since it treats the constitution of administrative sciences in a theoretical manner, while the epistemological options chosen clearly demand the study of its concrete processes. Therefore, it seems necessary to undertake the questioning of the orthodox model of administrative sciences by an empirical approach. In light of developments in the contemporary field of epistemology, it is clear that only in keeping with such an approach can the epistemology of administrative sciences develop in a pertinent manner.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":1}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":155},"tdmReady":false,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":406,"abstractCharCount":2776,"keywordCount":0,"score":8.667,"pdfWordCount":9985,"pdfCharCount":63009,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":12,"pdfPageSize":"612 x 828 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":832,"pdfText":true},"title":"Enjeux et controverses \u00e9pist\u00e9mologiques dans le champ des sciences de l'administration","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"author":[{"name":"A.R. Russia,","valery.nosulenko@gmail.com"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Activit\u00e9"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Perception"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Cognition"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Communication"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Qualit\u00e9 augment\u00e9"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Num\u00e9risation"}],"articleId":["10.1177_0539018408092579"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/M70-8Q0Q00SJ-7","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"How are we to analyze the activities that go on in digital environments whose components are distributed over space and time? We discuss these questions in the context of the theory of subject-oriented activity, which enables us to define the distinctive properties, content and structure of the activity. We have used the theory of mental images as another theoretical base. The `perceived quality' approach is a synthesis of the methodological contributions of these two theories. Starting from this point, we developed techniques for defining the subjective relevance of different elements mediating the activity located in the objects or in the environment. Their perceived quality includes both the observable properties of a situation and the characteristics of the subject (individual or group). The analysis aims to highlight either the perceived quality of the actual characteristics of the situation (here and now) or the history of its constitution (the former experience of the individual or the group) or the expectations of the individual (the content of his goals which anticipates a future situation). We discuss the positive contributions and the limitations of this approach, and illustrate them with case studies.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":79,"sectionCount":11,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":11,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":2,"tableCount":1,"refCount":45},"tdmReady":true,"score":9.16,"pdfWordCount":11173,"pdfCharCount":64769,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":27,"pdfPageSize":"391.181 x 612.283 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":414,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":180,"abstractCharCount":1216,"keywordCount":7},"title":"Mesurer les activit\u00e9s num\u00e9ris\u00e9es par leur qualit\u00e9 per\u00e7ue","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"title":"Cette recherche a \u00e9t\u00e9 subventionn\u00e9e par le Programme 'Technologies Cognitives' (Fondation Maison des Sciences de l'Homme/DEVAR et EDF R&D)"}},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"Streitz"}],"title":"Ambient Agoras (IST/Disappearing Computer Initiative contract","publicationDate":"2007"}},{"host":{"title":"Les documents sur les pr\u00e9sentations lors des journ\u00e9es 'Technologies cognitives' sont accessibles sur"}},{"host":{"title":"Cette probl\u00e9matique a \u00e9t\u00e9 profond\u00e9ment discut\u00e9e lors des journ\u00e9es 'Percevoir et \u00eatre per\u00e7u dans l'environnement num\u00e9ris\u00e9' et 'G\u00e9olocalisation: enjeux psychologiques et sociaux"}},{"host":{"volume":"47","pages":{"last":"63","first":"423"},"author":[{"name":"Yu I Alexandrov"}],"title":"How we fragment the world: view from inside versus view from outside', Social science information sur les sciences sociales","publicationDate":"2008"}},{"author":[{"name":"Yu I Alexandrov"},{"name":"M E Sams"}],"host":{"volume":"25","pages":{"last":"405","first":"387"},"title":"Cognitive brain research","publicationDate":"2005"},"title":"Emotion and consciousness: ends of a continuum"},{"author":[{"name":"V A Barabanshikov"}],"host":{"editor":"V. This text enacted among other things the new provisions for consent to experimentation. In this article, we summarize these provisions and highlight the necessity of excluding from the majority of research protocols, people unable to consent without legal representative. Thanks to the database of a recent study, we then show that this provision can render certain gerontological studies invalid. This leads us to recommend that the Civil Code be amended in a way to allow impaired persons who are not legally represented to participate in studies that do not pose any serious risk to their {"corpusName":"cambridge","author":[{"name":"Alastair McKinnon","affiliations":["McGill University"]}],"articleId":["03204"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6GQ-3XNVT72X-2","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"On tente souvent de calmer la frayeur de certains humanistes \u00e0 l'\u00e9gard de l'ordinateur en le qualifiant d' \u00ab infatigable idiot sans cervelle \u00bb. Je ne vois pas d'objection particuli\u00e8re \u00e0 cette description sinon qu'elle sugg\u00e8re une fausse r\u00e9ponse \u00e0 une question qui a troubl\u00e9 les philosophes r\u00e9cemment. Pour ma part, je m'int\u00e9resse tr\u00e8s peu \u00e0 la question tr\u00e8s g\u00e9n\u00e9rale et, \u00e0 mon avis, largement contrefaite de savoir si les ordinateurs peuvent \u00ab penser \u00bb. L'\u00e9ventualit\u00e9 que dans un proche avenir l'ordinateur soit en mesure de r\u00e9soudre les principaux probl\u00e8mes de la philosophie ne m'effraie pas, mais, par contre, je suis heureux de profiter de toute aide l\u00e0 o\u00f9 je la trouve. Quant \u00e0 moi, je ne me sens menac\u00e9 ni en tant qu'individu ni en tant que philosophe. Ce n'est pour moi qu'une simple r\u00e9alit\u00e9 de la vie contemporaine; un don de notre environnement technologique complexe; un outil passionnant dont nous pouvons profiter si nous sommes pr\u00eats \u00e0 en payer le prix. S'il nous d\u00e9truit dans l'avenir, \u00e9ventualit\u00e9 concevable, ce ne sera pas parce que la machine est intrins\u00e8quement mauvaise mais bien plus probablement parce que nous, les humanistes, aurons choisi de l'ignorer ou m\u00eame de la m\u00e9priser plut\u00f4t que de nous en servir avec un esprit critique et constructif \u00e0 nos propres fins. Ce sera parce que nous aurons pr\u00e9f\u00e9r\u00e9 conserver notre virginit\u00e9 d'\u00e9rudits plut\u00f4t que de nous m\u00ealer au tohu-bohu v\u00e9ritablement intellectuel et professionnel inh\u00e9rent aux humanit\u00e9s les plus authentiques.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":23,"sectionCount":4,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":4,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":2,"refCount":4},"tdmReady":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":243,"abstractCharCount":1488,"keywordCount":0,"score":9.916,"pdfWordCount":6480,"pdfCharCount":34737,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":19,"pdfPageSize":"395.28 x 632.88 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":341,"pdfText":true},"title":"La Philosophie et les ordinateurs","hasFormula":false,"pii":["S0012217300032042"],"refBibs":[{"host":{"editor":"p.i.","publisher":"Prentice-Hall","title":"Depuis 1950 plus de 1000 etudes ont ete publiees sur la question de savoir si les machines peuvent \u00ab penser","publicationDate":"1964"}},{"author":[{"name":"Kay De Martin"},{"name":"H Theodore ; {"corpusName":"springer-journals","author":[{"name":"Ana Vasquez"},{"name":"Michelle B. Proux"}],"articleId":["BF00597916","Art3"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/1BB-16P703CF-K","language":["fre"],"originalGenre":["OriginalPaper"],"abstract":"R\u00e9sum\u00e9: Les difficult\u00e9s scolaires \u00e9prouv\u00e9es par les \u00e9l\u00e8ves immigr\u00e9s ont \u00e9t\u00e9 g\u00e9n\u00e9ralement \u00e9tudi\u00e9es en mettant l'accent sur leurs carences ou sur les strat\u00e9gies d'adaptation dont ils se servent. Le travail qu'on pr\u00e9sente ici vise \u00e0 renverser cette optique \u2014 en inserant cette probl\u00e9matique dans le cadre th\u00e9orique de la Transculturation, et en \u00e9tudiant la fa\u00e7on dont ces \u00e9l\u00e8ves per\u00e7oivent l'institution scolaire. Les auteurs attirent l'attention sur la n\u00e9gociation d'une pr\u00e9sence controvers\u00e9e, que rend parfois particuli\u00e8rement difficile la libert\u00e9 de mouvement des chercheurs dans un espace \u00e0 la fois clos et tr\u00e8s compartiment\u00e9, notamment fait de lieux o\u00f9 les fronti\u00e8res entre priv\u00e9 et public et entre travail et hors travail sont mouvantes. Ils montrent aussi que la discussion avec les int\u00e9ress\u00e9s des interpr\u00e9tations produites peut \u00eatre \u00e0 la fois un moment d'appropriation pol\u00e9mique et l'occasion pour les acteurs d'exercer un regard critique sur leurs propres appartenances et pratiques. En permettant aux chercheurs de valider, de rectifier et d'enrichir leurs interpr\u00e9tations, les membres de l'\u00e9quipage deviennent des acteurs \u00e0 part enti\u00e8re de la production Au sein d\u2019une pratique bas\u00e9e sur les preuves, les analyses statistiques objectivent la pr\u00e9sence d\u2019arguments en faveur ou non des hypoth\u00e8ses pos\u00e9es au d\u00e9part par le chercheur. Mais \u00e9galement parce que la conclusion d\u2019une \u00e9tude repose sur les r\u00e9sultats des tests statistiques r\u00e9alis\u00e9s \u00e0 partir des groupes compar\u00e9s. LCFC, H\u00f4pital Erasme, Universit\u00e9 Libre de Bruxelles (U.L.B.), Brussels, Belgium"]},{"name":"Mathieu Bourguignon","affiliations":["Laboratoire de Cartographie Fonctionnelle du Cerveau - LCFC, H\u00f4pital Erasme, Universit\u00e9 Libre de Bruxelles (U.L.B.), Brussels, Belgium"]},{"name":"Paul Boon","affiliations":["Reference Centre for Refractory Epilepsy, Ghent University Hospital, Ghent, Belgium"]},{"name":"Kristl Vonck","affiliations":["Reference Centre for Refractory Epilepsy, Ghent University Hospital, Ghent, Belgium"]},{"name":"Benjamin Legros","affiliations":["Reference Centre for Refractory Epilepsy, H\u00f4pital Erasme, Universit\u00e9 Libre de Bruxelles (U.L.B.), Brussels, Belgium"]},{"name":"Serge Goldman","affiliations":["Laboratoire de Cartographie Fonctionnelle du Cerveau - LCFC, H\u00f4pital Erasme, Universit\u00e9 Libre de Bruxelles (U.L.B.), Brussels, Belgium","Corresponding author at: Magnetoencephalography Unit, Laboratoire de Cartographie Fonctionnelle du Cerveau, ULB-H\u00f4pital Erasme, 808 Lennik Street, Brussels, Belgium. Tel.: +32 2 555 31 11; fax: +32 2 555 47 01.","E-mail: xdetiege@ulb.ac.be"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Magnetoencephalography"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Magnetic shielded room"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Temporal lobe epilepsy"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Mesiotemporal"}],"articleId":["1758"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6H6-PSMLX0QG-3","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["Full-length article"],"abstract":"Abstract: ObjectiveTo assess the interictal epileptic discharges (IEDs) detection rate of magnetoencephalography (MEG) recordings performed in a new light-weight magnetic shielding (LMSR) concept in a large group of consecutive patients with presumed mesiotemporal lobe epilepsy (MTLE).MethodsThirty-eight patients (23 women; age range: 6\u201363 years) with presumed MTLE were prospectively studied. MEG investigations were performed with the 306-channel Elekta Neuromag\u00ae MEG-system installed in a normal hospital environment into a LMSR (MaxShield, Elekta Oy). Equivalent current dipoles (ECD, g/% >80%) corresponding to epileptic events were fitted to each patient's spherical head model at IEDs onset and peak and then superimposed on the patient's co-registered MRI.ResultsIEDs were observed in 26 out of 38 patients (68.4%). Temporal ECDs were mesial in 14 patients, anterior in 23 patients and posterior in 8 patients. Interestingly, in 6 patients, ECDs fitted at spike-onset were localized in the hippocampus while at the peak of the spike, they had an anterior temporal location.ConclusionsMEG using LMSR provides adequate signal to noise ratio (SNR) to allow reliable detection and localization of single epileptic abnormalities on continuous MEG data in 68% of patients with presumed MTLE. Moreover, mesial temporal epileptic sources were detected in 54% of patients with abnormal MEG. The SNR of MEG data acquired using the LMSR is therefore suitable for the non-invasive localization of epileptic foci in patients with MTLE. The use of LMSR, which are cheaper and smaller than conventional MSR, should facilitate the development of MEG in clinical En s\u2019appuyant sur des travaux r\u00e9alis\u00e9s dans le domaine du transfert de connaissances en sant\u00e9 et sur l\u2019analyse d\u2019une situation prototypique, cet article vise \u00e0 questionner la place des donn\u00e9es scientifiques dans les domaines pratiques en sant\u00e9 mentale en France. Une typologie des modes de transfert et d\u2019utilisation des connaissances pr\u00e9sente le mod\u00e8le conceptuel (qui regroupe le mode \u00ab\u00a0d\u00e9sint\u00e9ress\u00e9\u00a0\u00bb et le mode \u00ab\u00a0\u00e9clairage\u00a0\u00bb), le mod\u00e8le instrumental (qui comprend le mode \u00ab\u00a0expert\u00a0\u00bb et le mode \u00ab\u00a0r\u00e9solution de probl\u00e8me\u00a0\u00bb), le mod\u00e8le \u00ab\u00a0strat\u00e9gique\u00a0\u00bb, et le mod\u00e8le \u00ab\u00a0interactif\u00a0\u00bb. Diff\u00e9rents obstacles au processus de transfert recens\u00e9s dans la litt\u00e9rature sont ensuite expos\u00e9s\u00a0: les probl\u00e8mes associ\u00e9s aux questions et r\u00e9sultats de recherche, ceux associ\u00e9s \u00e0 la diffusion, et ceux en lien avec la rencontre de cultures organisationnelles diff\u00e9rentes. We call a configuration of a metaheuristic any possible instantiation of this template while with the expression tuning problem we denote the problem of properly instantiating the template, that is, the problem of choosing among the set of possible components and assigning specific values to all free parameters. As practitioners know, metaheuristics are in general quite sensitive to the value of their parameters and a careful fine-tuning typically improves the performance in a significant way. This chapter is devoted to the definition of a formal framework in which the tuning problem can be cast and solved. Before entering in the technical details, an informal description of a typical situation in which the tuning problem arises is given in Section 3.1. In Section 3.2 we give the formal position of the problem and in Section 3.3 we discuss some possible extensions and variants. Section 3.4 summarizes and discusses the results presented in the chapter.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":68,"sectionCount":14,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":14}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":4,"tableCount":0,"refCount":0},"tdmReady":true,"score":9.112,"pdfWordCount":6087,"pdfCharCount":29838,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":15,"pdfPageSize":"430 x 659.996 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":406,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":176,"abstractCharCount":1133,"keywordCount":0},"title":"Statement of the Tuning Problem","hasFormula":true,"chapterId":["3","Chap3"],"refBibs":[{"host":{"title":"Discussion"}}],"genre":["article"],"serie":{"title":"Studies in Computational Intelligence","language":["unknown"],"copyrightDate":"2009","issn":["1860-949X"],"eissn":["1860-9503"],"editor":[{"name":"Janusz Kacprzyk","affiliations":["Systems Research Institute, Polish Academy of Sciences, ul. {"corpusName":"wiley","keywords":{"teeft":["cette","ainsi","dont","fait","cela","mathematique","peut","problemes","aussi","comme","sont","exemple","probleme","dualisme","bouligand","assez","celle","vers","celui","faire","effet","autre","theorie","leur","avec","moins","fois","chercheur","problkme","processus","mise","termes","ayant","recours","sujet","toutes","categorie","vient","champ","sou","recherche","sans","fait apparaitre","synthbse globale","cette synthkse","cette derniere","dualisme annonce","solution unique","r6le essentiel","occasion nombreuses","structure algebriques","coefficient entiers","hypothesis subsidiaires","structure topologiques","convergence simple","genre"]},"author":[{"name":"G. Bouligand","affiliations":["Paris"]}],"articleId":["DLTC121"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-VJ0D4NVP-Q","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"A comprehensive study of mathematical thought, taking the actual works for its basis, will examine mathematical activity first. Such activity has always set itself mutually dependent aims of two sorts: The solving of problems, i.e. determining some unknown element under precise conditions; And the achieving of a synthesis which, in the presence of new problems, simplifies and, if necessary, coordinates anew the known facts of whatever sort (methods, operational potentialities\u2026). This is what allows us to draw up a specific scheme regarding the historical evolution of deductive science, the dialectical aspect of that evolution has been stressed as far as possible. It brings in Logic in a natural way, and shows clearly how \u3008mathematisation\u3009 operates in a wide field.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":1}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":0},"tdmReady":false,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":119,"abstractCharCount":774,"keywordCount":0,"score":7.095,"pdfWordCount":7241,"pdfCharCount":36927,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":19,"pdfPageSize":"432 x 648 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":381,"pdfText":true},"title":"L'ACTIVIT\u00c9 MATHBMATIQUE ET SON DUALISME","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[],"genre":["article"],"host":{"title":"Dialectica","language":["unknown"],"doi":["10.1111/(ISSN)1746-8361"],"issn":["0012-2017"],"eissn":["1746-8361"],"publisherId":["DLTC"],"volume":"11","issue":"1\u20102","pages":{"first":"121","last":"139","total":"19"},"genre":["journal"]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"date":["11s"],"persName":["M. {"corpusName":"sage","keywords":{"teeft":["individus","cette","analyse","graphique","recodage","entre","donn6es","significatifs","typologie","sont","factorielle","noyaux","fichier","r6sultats","fictifs","niveau","arbitraires","sociales","comme","donnees","resultats","tr6s","automatique","avon","donc","chaque","valeurs","groupes","correspondances","travail","niveaux","fait","grandes","effet","presque","science sociales","classification automatique","recherche","avec","noyaux significatifs","valeurs arbitraires","analyse factorielle","centre fix","composantes principales","premier travail","avon fait","citation directe","chaque variable","notre premier travail","autres r6sultats","variable arbitraires","service informatique","variable dont","base consiste","base comme","intelligence artificielle","variable graphique","statistical result","simple recoding","basic typology"]},"author":[{"name":"VAN METER Karl M.","affiliations":["LISH-CNRS"]}],"articleId":["10.1177_075910638400400106"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/M70-DDC46F54-P","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"A fundamental characteristic that every social scientist requires of his statistical results is that they remain \"stable\". This concept includes various ideas, each of a different nature. Research demonstrates that statistical results are not resistant to data recoding even when it is a question of a simple recoding of the variables by their modes which is often used in social science research. Thus, there is a first criteria for stability: the results must remain independant of a simple recoding of the basic data. A second research shows that there are at least two types of randomness: a first type is the introduction of arbitrary data that is distributed in a homogeneous fashion among the subjects. This type of randomness modifies very little the structure of the results. A second type is the introduction of fictitious subjects with descriptive variables that have arbitrary values. This type of randomness can modify the structure of the results. These two notions can be confounded by reseachers on a conceptual level, even if they do distinguish between them on a pratical level in their reseach activity. Thus there is a second criteria for stability: the structure of the results must resist the progressive introduction of arbitrary information or \"noise\". A third research, which uses four \"classical\" methods of multivariate analysis employed in social science (two classificatory types: dynamic clusters and fixed center typology analysis - two factorial types: correspondance analysis and principal component analysis), demonstrates that there exist basic types (which constitute a basic typology) that remain unchanged for these four methods, but they are only revealed by the confrontation and the crossing of the results of several methods. Thus there is a third criteria for stability: the results must not rely on one method or one kind of method. We end with a description of other caracteristics that clearly define a basic typology.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":0,"sectionCount":0,"sectionLevels":[],"sectionDepth":0,"imageCount":1,"tableCount":1,"refCount":14},"tdmReady":false,"score":7.895,"pdfWordCount":4228,"pdfCharCount":24269,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":17,"pdfPageSize":"415 R\u00e9sultats- La Typologie de Base en Sciences Sociales","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"title":"Graphique I : Classification automatique des variables de Paris {"corpusName":"springer-journals","keywords":{"teeft":["loss function","menges","marschak","perte","likelihood function","fonction","utility function","drygas","likelihood estimate","werden","true parameter","optimal estimate","risk function","maximum likelihood","inference measure","objective behaviour","sample space","parameter vector","parameter space","false estimate","identity matrix","estimation function","average loss","continuous parameter space","oder nutzenfunktion","likelihood"]},"author":[{"name":"G. Menges","affiliations":["Lehrstuhl f\u00fcr \u00d6konometrie, Universit\u00e4t Heidelberg, Bergheimerstra\u00dfe 147, 69 Heidelberg"]},{"name":"B. Jacke","affiliations":["Universit\u00e4t Heidelberg, Bergheimerstra\u00dfe 147, 69 Heidelberg"]}],"articleId":["BF02922906","Art9"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/1BB-6G0B3494-6","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["OriginalPaper"],"abstract":"Zusammenfassung: In diesem Aufsatz werden zun\u00e4chst die beiden Konzepte, Marschaks Begriff der Nutzenfunktion des Wissenschaftlers und das Maximum Likelihood-Prinzip, dargestellt und interpretiert. Dann werden die beiden Konzepte miteinander verbunden: Der Statistiker, als eine Subspecies des Wissenschaftlers, hat Entscheidungen auf der Basis einer Verlust- oder Nutzenfunktion von Marschaks Art zu treffen, z.B. betrachtet der Wissenschaftler bei der Punktsch\u00e4tzung jede falsche Sch\u00e4tzung als gleich schlecht und als gut nur die Sch\u00e4tzung, die mit dem wahren Parameter \u00fcbereinstimmt. Um die Beziehung zwischen den beiden Konzepten zu beweisen, wird die gew\u00f6hnliche Definition der Verlustfunktion durch ein Verlustma\u00df ersetzt, welches als der durchschnittliche Verlust interpretiert werden kann, den der Wissenschaftler (Statistiker) zu erleiden hat, wenn der wahre Parameter in einer bestimmten Untermenge des Parameterraums liegt, w\u00e4hrend er eine bestimmte Sch\u00e4tzung akzeptiert. Wir beweisen sodann (eine Verallgemeinerung eines Satzes von Drygas und Menges): Wenn die Maximum Likelihood-Sch\u00e4tzungen (oder Hypothesen oder Propositionen) t1,...,tn aus den \u00fcblichen Maximum Likelihood-Gleichungen gewonnen werden, dann gibt es eine verallgemeinerte Verlustfunktion vom Marschak\u2019schen Typ derart, da\u00df f\u00fcr jedes\u025b>0 und f\u00fcr die optimalen (risikominimierenden) Sch\u00e4tzungen bez\u00fcglich dieser Verlustfunktion die folgende Beziehung gilt: . Dieser Satz zeigt, da\u00df die Sch\u00e4tzungen (Hypothesen, Propositionen), welche auf Grund der Maximum Likelihood-Regel akzeptiert werden, auf einer bestimmten Verlustfunktion beruhen und da\u00df diese Verlustfunktion eine unmittelbare Verallgemeinerung der Verlustfunktion des Wissenschaftlers ist. Die Verlust- oder Nutzenfunktion des Wissenschaftlers ist somit als tragf\u00e4hige Basis einer entscheidungstheoretischen Interpretation des Maximum Likelihood-Prinzips geeignet, eine Interpretation, welche in jedem Fall unerl\u00e4\u00dflich ist, da das Maximum Likelihood-Prinzip selbst ein Entscheidungskriterium darstellt. Zum Schlu\u00df werden die Betrachtungen noch kurz auf Verlustfunktionen ausgedehnt, welche nicht vom Marschak\u2019schen Typ sind, d.h. auf den Fall, da\u00df der Statistiker ein \"Praktiker\" ist oder als solcher agiert, und es werden die \u00dcberlegungen mit einer wichtigen, einschl\u00e4gigen Bemerkung von Walsh konfrontiert, haupts\u00e4chlich im Zusammenhang mit dem Begriff der Subjektivit\u00e4t.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":1,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":0},"tdmReady":false,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":298,"abstractCharCount":2407,"keywordCount":0,"score":8,"pdfWordCount":10931,"pdfCharCount":31015,"pdfVersion":1.3,"pdfPageCount":21,"pdfPageSize":"450 x 666 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":521,"pdfText":true},"title":"The scientist\u2019s utility function and the principle of maximum likelihood","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"author":[{"name":"D Blackwell"},{"name":"M A Girshick"}],"title":"Theory of Games and Statistical Decisions","publicationDate":"1954"}},{"host":{"volume":"6","pages":{"last":"134","first":"12"},"author":[{"name":"H Diehl"},{"name":"D Und"},{"name":"Sprott"}],"title":"Die Likelihoodfunktion und ihre Verwendung beim statistischen SchluB, Statistische Hefte","publicationDate":"1965"}},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"H Drygas"},{"name":"G Und"},{"name":"Menges"}],"publisher":"Econometric Society","title":"On the Use of Loss Functions in Econometric Estimation Problems","publicationDate":"1971-09"}},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"J Marschak"},{"name":"R Radner"}],"publisher":"Yale University Press","title":"Economic Theory of. Partant du cas de la France, les chiffres de l\u2019\u00e9pid\u00e9miologie indiquent en effet qu\u2019en d\u00e9pit de l\u2019information dont ils disposent sur les modalit\u00e9s de contamination par le VIH et les r\u00e8gles de pr\u00e9vention, certains homosexuels ne se prot\u00e8gent pas syst\u00e9matiquement de cette maladie sexuellement transmissible. Le taux de pr\u00e9valence du VIH \u00e9tant chez les gays pr\u00e8s de 120\u00a0fois plus \u00e9lev\u00e9 que chez les h\u00e9t\u00e9rosexuels, cet \u00e9chec relatif de la pr\u00e9vention est un enjeu majeur du domaine de la sant\u00e9 publique. L\u2019article distingue dans les recherches qui tentent d\u2019expliquer ces prises de risque celles qui fondent leurs m\u00e9thodologies sur des questionnaires pr\u00e9\u00e9tablis pass\u00e9s \u00e0 des cohortes d\u2019individus et trait\u00e9s par la statistique, de celles qui a contrario permettent aux r\u00e9pondants des enqu\u00eates de d\u00e9tailler leurs v\u00e9cus subjectifs de mani\u00e8re plus particularis\u00e9e. Du point de vue de l\u2019article, c\u2019est ce second type d\u2019\u00e9tudes qui semble le plus \u00e0 m\u00eame de fournir des donn\u00e9es heuristiques \u00e0 la recherche en psychopathologie clinique. Pour affiner et compl\u00e9ter ces \u00e9tudes, l\u2019article pr\u00e9sente quelques r\u00e9sultats de recherche du dispositif clinique mis en place par les deux auteurs sur le sujet \u00e9tudi\u00e9. \u00c0 partir d\u2019un cas clinique atypique, ils montrent la pertinence d\u2019une analyse psychopathologique des prises de risque sexuel chez les homosexuels masculins qui prend en compte la dimension inconsciente du fait psychique.","qualityIndicators":{"pdfVersion":1.7,"abstractCharCount":1652,"pdfPageCount":25,"tdmReady":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"imageCount":0,"refCount":31,"sectionCount":13,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":1,"level":0},{"sectionCount":12,"level":1}],"tableCount":0,"sectionDepth":2,"paragraphCount":111},"score":10,"pdfPageSize":"467 x 680 pts","refBibsNative":true,"keywordCount":20,"pdfWordCount":16208,"pdfWordsPerPage":648,"pdfCharCount":86225,"abstractWordCount":254,"pdfText":true,"hasStructuredBody":true},"title":"Les prises de risque sexuel li\u00e9es au VIH-sida chez les homosexuels masculins\u00a0: synth\u00e8se des recherches sociologiques et psychologiques, perspectives cliniques","pii":["S0014-3855(13)00025-X"],"refBibs":[{"host":{"volume":"78","pages":{"last":"449","first":"425"},"author":[{"name":"P Bonny"},{"name":"F"}],"title":"Sauvagnat / L&amp;apos;\u00e9volution psychiatrique","publicationDate":"2013"}},{"host":{"title":"D\u00e9claration d&amp;apos;int\u00e9r\u00eats Les auteurs d\u00e9clarent ne pas avoir de conflits d&amp;apos;int\u00e9r\u00eats en relation avec cet article"}},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"C Broqua"},{"name":"Y Souteyrand"}],"title":"Homosexualit\u00e9s au temps du sida. {"corpusName":"wiley","keywords":{"teeft":["pratique","connaissance","reflexion","langage","elle","peut","cette","sont","toute","marque","naturelle","niveau","ainsi","fait","laquelle","etre","entre","mathematiques","laisse","doit","dont","toutes","rationnelle","systeme","toute connaissance","evocation","trois horizon","langage interieur","systeme structure","correspondance avec","cette pratique","sans","connaissance scientifique","structure physiologiques","patre chaldeen","correspondance entre","association interieures","evocation nouvelles","meme structure","logique classique","decouverte fera demain","sont accessibles","certain level"]},"author":[{"name":"Fran\u00e7ois Moch"}],"articleId":["DLTC1669"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-C1LJVTXP-9","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"R\u00e9sum\u00e9: Vivre, agir, c'est participer \u00e0 des r\u00e9p\u00e9titions qui laissent en nous une marque et finissent par nous faire acqu\u00e9rir une pratique. La r\u00e9flexion vient ensuite, utilise ces marques, en forme des images qu'elle peut \u00e9voquer \u00e0 volont\u00e9, et qu'elle structure en repr\u00e9sentations: langage int\u00e9rieur, puis langage de communication. Une \u00ab intuition \u00bb est l'affleurement conscient d'une marque laiss\u00e9e par la pratique, et son insertion quasi\u2010instantan\u00e9e dans le syst\u00e8me des repr\u00e9sentations internes. Les progr\u00e8s altern\u00e9s dans la pratique, dans l'association des images, dans le langage, dans l'action se suscitent les uns les autres, au cours d'une \u00e9volution conditionn\u00e9e par nos structures physiologiques (dont nous n'avons jamais encore \u00e9puis\u00e9 toutes les possibilit\u00e9s). La pratique sur laquelle s'exerce ainsi la r\u00e9flexion peut \u011btre la pratique m\u011bme de la r\u00e9flexion. A chaque pratique particuli\u00e8re s'associe une technique: \u00e0 l'origine empirique, puis, par r\u00e9flexions successives, rationnelle, math\u00e9matique, formelle (ceci est un sch\u00e9ma d'abstraction, non un r\u00e9sum\u00e9 historique). Mais toute math\u00e9matique suppose un math\u00e9maticien, tout langage formalis\u00e9 un m\u00e9ta\u2010langage, et la connaissance ne se laisse jamais enfermer dans une technique ultime: on retrouve les trois horizons de l'idon\u00e9isme. Le d\u00e9veloppement intellectuel qui va d'un niveau au niveau sup\u00e9rieur est \u00e0 rapprocher du d\u00e9veloppement de l'embryon; l'ontogen\u00e8se r\u00e9p\u00e8te la Phylogen\u00e8se; on ne peut atteindre un niveau de connaissances qu'en passant par les niveaux interm\u00e9diaires atteints successivement par nos pr\u00e9d\u00e9cesseurs; il n'existe pas de raccourci, et la connaissance future ne peut \u011btre pr\u00e9vue par les moyens de la connaissance actuelle. Summary: To live and to act is to share in repetitions which impress marks upon us and eventually makes us acquire a practice. Reflection comes later on, using those marks, shaping them into images that it can conjure up at will, and structuring them into representations: first inner language, then communication language. An \u00ab intuition \u00bb is the conscious outcrop of a mark left by practice and its quasi\u2010instantaneous insertion into the system of inner representations. Alternating progress in practice, in image\u2010 association, in language and in action give rise to one another in the course of an evolution conditionned by our physiological structure (the possibilities of which we have never yet exhausted). The practice on which reflection exerts itself can be the very practice of reflection. To each particular practice is associated a technique, originally empirical, then, through a succession of reflections, rational, mathematical, formal (this is an abstract scheme, not a historical summary). But every mathematics supposes a mathematician, every formalized language a metalanguage, and knowledge can never be shut into an ultimate technique: one is once more confronted with the three horizons of idoneism. Intellectual development, going from a certain level to an upper level, is to be compared with the development of an embryo; ontogenesis repeats phylogenesis; one can only reach a certain level of knowledge by going through intermediate levels successively reached to by our predecessors; there is no short cut, and future knowledge cannot be foreseen through the ways of present knowledge.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":1}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":0},"tdmReady":false,"score":8.893,"pdfWordCount":3893,"pdfCharCount":21540,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":11,"pdfPageSize":"468 x 684 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":354,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":491,"abstractCharCount":3314,"keywordCount":0},"title":"PRATIQUE ET CONNAISSANCE","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[],"genre":["article"],"host":{"title":"Dialectica","language":["unknown"],"doi":["10.1111/(ISSN)1746-8361"],"issn":["0012-2017"],"eissn":["1746-8361"],"publisherId":["DLTC"],"volume":"16","issue":"1","pages":{"first":"45","last":"55","total":"11"},"genre":["journal"]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"persName":["M. Gonseth","S. C. Nets","Gonseth"]}},"ark":["ark:/67375/WNG-C1LJVTXP-9"],"categories":{"wos":[],"scienceMetrix":["1 - arts & humanities","2 - philosophy & theology","3 - philosophy"],"scopus":["1 - Social Sciences","2 - Arts and Humanities","3 - Philosophy"],"inist":["1 - sciences humaines et sociales","2 - histoire et sciences de la litterature"]},"publicationDate":"1962","copyrightDate":"1962","enrichments":{"type":["multicat","nb","teeft","unitex"]},"doi":["10.1111/j.1746-8361.1962.tb01669.x"]}

{"corpusName":"springer-journals","keywords":{"teeft":["ernesto","molinchart","echegaray","champfleury","ville","teodora","rumor mill","galeoto","bovary","gran galeoto","amann","ursule","madame bovary","creton","julien","mundo","parle","todo","toute","flaubert","adultery","adultery plot","crivain chercheur","bourgeois","adultery novel","large extent","louise","rumor","protagonist","subversive current","jules husson","infidelity plot","provincial village","bourgeois housewife","provincial life","opening chapter","petite ville","main plot","many critic","different logic","emma bovary","inverted causality","anonymous collectivity","multiple incident","unos cuantos tipos","different way","main character","suggestive force","infidelity"]},"author":[{"name":"Elizabeth Amann","affiliations":["Vakgroep Letterkunde, Ghent University, Blandijnberg 2, 9000, Ghent, Belgium","E-mail: elizabeth.amann@ugent.be"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Infidelity plot"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Adultery novel"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Jos\u00e9 Echegaray"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"El gran Galeoto"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Champfleury (Jules Husson)"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Les bourgeois de Molinchart"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Calumny"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Gossip"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Rumor"}],"articleId":["178","s11059-013-0178-9"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/VQC-H9QX55TV-M","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["OriginalPaper"],"abstract":"Abstract: This article seeks to challenge interpretations of the adultery plot as a subversive current in nineteenth-century literature by examining two texts that are often dismissed by contemporary critics: Les bourgeois de Molinchart (1854), a novel by the French writer Champfleury (the pseudonym of Jules Husson), and El gran Galeoto (1881), a play by the Spanish playwright Jos\u00e9 Echegaray. In each of these works, the rumor of the adultery precedes and to a large extent precipitates the infidelity at the end of the work. In committing adultery, therefore, the protagonists are not rising up against social norms so much as capitulating to the expectations of society, enacting a plot that has been projected upon them. The essay compares and contrasts the treatment of the rumor mill in the two works and examines the literary strategies that the writers use to undercut a transgressive reading of the infidelity plot.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":41,"sectionCount":5,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":5,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":1,"tableCount":0,"refCount":26},"tdmReady":true,"score":7.443,"pdfWordCount":7619,"pdfCharCount":39453,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":15,"pdfPageSize":"439.37 x 666.142 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":508,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":148,"abstractCharCount":926,"keywordCount":9},"title":"Adultery and the rumor mill: Les bourgeois de Molinchart and El gran galeoto","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"author":[{"name":"E Amann"}],"publisher":"Palgrave","title":"Importing Madame Bovary: The politics of adultery","publicationDate":"2006"}},{"author":[{"name":"E Caldera"}],"host":{"volume":"1","pages":{"last":"98","first":"85"},"publisher":"Michel L\u00e9vy Fr\u00e8res","title":"Champfleury. {"corpusName":"springer-journals","author":[{"name":"Daniel K\u00fcbler","affiliations":["Department d'architecture Ecole polytechnique f\u00e9d\u00e9rale de Lausanne, Institut de recherche sur l'environnement construit (EPFL), Case postale 555, CH-1001, Lausanne","Institut de science politique (Universit\u00e9 de Lausanne), CH-1001, Lausanne"]},{"name":"Dominique Hausser","affiliations":["Department d'architecture Ecole polytechnique f\u00e9d\u00e9rale de Lausanne, Institut de recherche sur l'environnement construit (EPFL), Case postale 555, CH-1001, Lausanne"]},{"name":"Dominique Joye","affiliations":["Department d'architecture Ecole polytechnique f\u00e9d\u00e9rale de Lausanne, Institut de recherche sur l'environnement construit (EPFL), Case postale 555, CH-1001, Lausanne"]}],"articleId":["BF01318593","Art11"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/VQC-KRXL9STJ-C","language":["fre"],"originalGenre":["OriginalPaper"],"abstract":"R\u00e9sum\u00e9: Dans le contexte d'une l\u00e9gislation qui interdit la consommation d'h\u00e9ro\u00efne et de coca\u00efne, mener des enqu\u00eates aupr\u00e8s des consommateurs de ces substances pose des probl\u00e8mes m\u00e9thodologiques consid\u00e9rables. Ceci est particuli\u00e8rement vrai pour les consommateurs hors traitement qui ne peuvent \u00eatre recrut\u00e9s \u00e0 travers les structures de prise en charge. Dans une recherche sur les consommateurs d'h\u00e9ro\u00efne etlou de coca\u00efne hors traitement m\u00e9dical, un \u00e9chantillon de 917 individus fut constitu\u00e9 par la m\u00e9thode des \u201cinterlocuteurs privil\u00e9gi\u00e9s\u201d sur l'ensemble du territoire national. Les probl\u00e8mes de fiabilit\u00e9 et de validit\u00e9 de cette m\u00e9thode sont discut\u00e9s dans une premi\u00e8re partie de l'article. Ensuite, nous discutons, \u00e0 partir de cet \u00e9chantillon de 917 personnes, des aspects touchant \u00e0 l'utilisation des services d'\u00e9change et de distribution de mat\u00e9riel d'injection st\u00e9rile. Tout en \u00e9tant minoritaires dans l'\u00e9chantillon (n=238), ce sont avant tout les personnes consommant par voie intraveineuse qui utilisent ces services. Il appara\u00eet que la principale raison de non-utilisation par les injecteurs est l'absence de tels services dans certaines r\u00e9gions du pays. L\u00e0 o\u00f9 ils existent, ces services correspondent donc \u00e0 un besoin qu'ils arrivent \u00e0 couvrir. Dans les r\u00e9gions sans services d'\u00e9change ou de distribution de mat\u00e9riel d'injection, les pharmacies sont davantage sollicit\u00e9es pour l'approvisionnement en seringues st\u00e9riles, sans pour autant compenser l'absence des services \u00e0 bas seuil. Dans ces r\u00e9gions, les injections avec des seringues d\u00e9j\u00e0 utilis\u00e9es par quelqu'un d'autre sont plus \u00e9lev\u00e9e. Du point de vue de la pr\u00e9vention du sida, il y a donc urgence de d\u00e9velopper des services d'\u00e9change et de distribution de mat\u00e9riel d'injection partout en Suisse.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":1,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":0},"tdmReady":false,"score":7.953,"pdfWordCount":4953,"pdfCharCount":28816,"pdfVersion":1.3,"pdfPageCount":9,"pdfPageSize":"597.28 x 785 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":550,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":258,"abstractCharCount":1758,"keywordCount":0},"title":"Consommateurs de drogues hors traitement m\u00e9dical: Aspects m\u00e9thodologiques et pratiques","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"pages":{"last":"687","first":"681"},"issue":"88","title":"Addiction","publicationDate":"1993"}},{"author":[{"name":"J Keene"},{"name":"G Stimson"},{"name":"S Jones"},{"name":"N Parrylandon"}],"host":{"pages":{"last":"1070","first":"1063"},"issue":"88","title":"Addiction","publicationDate":"1993"},"title":"Evaluation of syringe exchange for HIV prenvention among injecting drug users in rural and urban areas of Wales"},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"C Landert"}],"title":"Freier beffagen. {"corpusName":"elsevier","author":[{"name":"D. Pasquier","affiliations":["E-mail: dpasquier@avenirentreprise.fr","EA 2114, psychologie des \u00e2ges de la vie, universit\u00e9 Fran\u00e7ois-Rabelais de Tours, 37000 Tours, France"]},{"name":"R. Gras","affiliations":["E-mail: dpasquier@avenirentreprise.fr","\u00c9quipe connaissance et d\u00e9cision, laboratoire d\u2019informatique de Nantes-Atlantique (LINA), UMR 6241, \u00e9cole polytechnique de l\u2019universit\u00e9 de Nantes, 44000 Nantes, France"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Analyse statistique implicative"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Recherche exploratoire"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Approche corr\u00e9lationnelle"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Statistical implicative analysis"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Exploratory research"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Correlational approach"}],"articleId":["254"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6H6-LZ8JCWJZ-8","language":["fre"],"originalGenre":["Full-length article"],"abstract":"R\u00e9sum\u00e9: Les psychologues utilisent fr\u00e9quemment des approches corr\u00e9lationnelles pour mener \u00e0 bien l\u2019analyse de leurs tableaux de donn\u00e9es (corr\u00e9lations, r\u00e9gressions, analyse en composantes principales...). De leur c\u00f4t\u00e9, les didacticiens pratiquent l\u2019analyse statistique implicative (ASI). Dans ce papier, les auteurs pr\u00e9sentent quelques arguments, illustr\u00e9s d\u2019exemples, en faveur d\u2019une utilisation conjointe des deux approches m\u00e9thodologiques. Si la corr\u00e9lation permet d\u2019identifier la polarit\u00e9 (le signe) et l\u2019amplitude (la valeur absolue) des liens entre deux ou plusieurs variables, son aspect sym\u00e9trique ne permet pas d\u2019ordonner les variables. L\u2019ASI compl\u00e8te l\u2019approche corr\u00e9lationnelle dans la mesure o\u00f9 la forme asym\u00e9trique de l\u2019indice d\u2019intensit\u00e9 de l\u2019implication d\u00e9bouche sur une mise en ordre quasi-implicative des variables corr\u00e9l\u00e9es\u00a0: a\u21d2b \u00ab\u00a0si la variable a est observ\u00e9e dans la population alors on note une propension \u00e0 observer la variable b\u00a0\u00bb. Reste \u00e0 interpr\u00e9ter cet ordre implicatif, ce qui renvoie \u00e0 une autre dissuasifs","foyer dexigence"]},"author":[{"name":"St\u00e9phane Dion"}],"articleId":["CAPA95"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-5R9TSX51-H","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"Sommaire: La politisation des administrations publiques par les partis fait l'objet dun d\u00e9bat permanent qui s'amplifie \u00e0 chaque alternance du pouvoir. Elle est tant\u00f4t r\u00e9prouv\u00e9e comme une perversion dangereuse du mod\u00e8le occidental d'administration, tant\u00f4t accueillie comme une forme plus moderne de gouvernement. Ce d\u00e9bat \u00e9thique campe bien les dimensions du probl\u00e9me, il ne permet pas de l'analyser. Les \u00e9\u00e9l\u00e9ments d'analyse propos\u00e9s dans cet article s'organisent autour de la distinction entre deux objectifs de politisation. 1) On peut politiser l'administration dans le but de placer directement ses resources et ses effectifs \u00e0 la disposition des appareils de partis. L'administration devient alors un instrument de patronage ou de client\u00e9lisme. 2) On peut chercher \u00e0 rendre un plus grand nombre de fonctionnaires politiquement solidaires des \u00e9lus, de sorte que l'administration devienne un instrument plus efficace de con\u2010cr\u00e9tisation des politiques gouvernementales. L'auteur discute des implications strat\u00e9giques de ces deux objectifs de politisation et soutient que, sans \u00e9tre contradic\u2010toires, ils se concilient difficilement. Abstract. The politicization of public administrations by the political parties is subject to increasing controversy each time there is a change of government. Sometimes rejected as a dangerous subversion of the western model of government, politicization is at other times welcomed as a more modern form of administration. Although this ethical debate quantifies the problem, the latter cannot be analyzed as a result. The analytical elements proposed in this article are based on a distinction between two objectives of politicization: 1) the administration may be politicized in order to place its resources and staff directly at the disposal of the party apparatus; governments thus become an instrument for patronage or special interests; 2) an attempt could be made to render a greater number of civil servants politically supportive of the elective representatives, so that the administration will become a more effective tool for implementing government policy. After discussing the strategic implications of these two politicization objectives, the author argues that, while not contradictory, they are often difficult to reconcile.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":1}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":0},"tdmReady":false,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":327,"abstractCharCount":2275,"keywordCount":0,"score":8.667,"pdfWordCount":10874,"pdfCharCount":62809,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":23,"pdfPageSize":"460.8 x 702.24 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":473,"pdfText":true},"title":"La politisation des administrations publiques: \u00e9l\u00e9ments d'analyse strat\u00e9gique","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"title":"Le premier a voulu traiter dans son lime des affinitk politiques entre ministres et hauts fonctionnaires canadiens, le second en a deduit que le gouvemement f&kral se faisait accuser de partisanerie ouverte A revisionist History of Planning Process in Ottawa? {"corpusName":"cambridge","author":[{"name":"J. Vanderlinden"}],"articleId":["00602"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6GQ-QPL5WNNT-M","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"There are two aspects to this subject. On the one hand, one may investigate the background of the students for whom this teaching is intended. Some persons think that one must be concerned with courses aimed principally at Africans who are unable to attend university in their countries of origin; others think that such courses should be open to all who are interested in comparative law and should place African legal systems on the same level as those of the common law countries or Soviet law. On the other hand, experts in this field are divided on the question of the place which African law should occupy in the general structure of university curricula; in some people's view it is useful to distinguish the traditional law from the modern law, associating the former with the social sciences and the latter with law proper. Other specialists think that it is not possible to teach African law without first giving the student a solid grounding in the sociology, politics, and economics of the African continent.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":39,"sectionCount":15,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":15,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":3,"tableCount":9,"refCount":0},"tdmReady":true,"score":8.409,"pdfWordCount":16099,"pdfCharCount":89450,"pdfVersion":1.5,"pdfPageCount":28,"pdfPageSize":"406.08 x 634.32 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":575,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":173,"abstractCharCount":1020,"keywordCount":0},"title":"La Participation des Facult\u00e9s et Institutions de Recherche Europ\u00e9ennes au D\u00e9veloppement Juridique Africain.","hasFormula":true,"pii":["S0021855300006021"],"refBibs":[],"genre":["research-article"],"host":{"title":"Journal of African Law","language":["unknown"],"issn":["0021-8553"],"eissn":["1464-3731"],"publisherId":["JAL"],"volume":"15","issue":"1","pages":{"first":"13","last":"40","total":"28"},"genre":["journal"]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"date":["1971"],"orgName":["RESEARCH INTO AFRICAN LAW IN AFRICA Legal","Ministry of Overseas","RESEARCH INTO AFRICAN LAW IN EUROPE","FACULTIES AND RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS IN AFRICAN LEGAL DEVELOPMENT","Congress","African Law Center"],"persName":["Dr. Milner","C.R.E.D.I.L.A. de Dakar","Quant","J.A.L. {"corpusName":"cambridge","author":[{"name":"Michel Amiot","affiliations":["CNRS, Centre d'\u00e9tudes des mouvements sociaux (Paris)."]}],"articleId":["00719"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6GQ-VXXHDQMM-K","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"This study was conducted through interviews with a sample of researchers from French laboratories. It has brought to light two main themes which are interlinked: (i) all laboratories which reach a certain level of development are laboured by a diversification of their teams which tends to compartmentalise them; (2) this compartmentalisation is offset. The laboratory is thus the level at which one finds and manages the problem of unity posed by the compartmentalisation of teams which are open to the whole scientific field. The nature of networks depends mainly on two variables: the weight of instrumentation and the degree of unification of problematics or thematics. Weakly integrated networks are found in those disciplines which use technologies which are easily disseminated because of their low cost, as well as those disciplines which have low degrees of theoretical unification. Nuclear physics and astrophysics are examples of the most integrated networks. A division of labour has recently developed in molecular genetics which has become de localised between different laboratory teams. We can describe these networks as paradoxical.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":76,"sectionCount":17,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":17,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":5,"tableCount":2,"refCount":5},"tdmReady":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":174,"abstractCharCount":1149,"keywordCount":0,"score":9.088,"pdfWordCount":20927,"pdfCharCount":114609,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":49,"pdfPageSize":"410.4 x 637.2 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":427,"pdfText":true},"title":"Le laboratoire entre \u00e9quipes et r\u00e9seaux. {"corpusName":"elsevier","author":[{"name":"Nicole Barthe","affiliations":["Inserm U577, laboratoire de biophysique, universit\u00e9 Victor-Segalen, 146, rue L\u00e9o-Saignat, 33076 Bordeaux 2, cedex France","E-mail: nicole.barthe@u-bordeaux2.fr"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Radioactivit\u00e9"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Autoradiographie"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Imagerie b\u00eata"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Imagerie mol\u00e9culaire"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Scintigraphie"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Radioactivity"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Autoradiography"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Beta imaging"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Molecular imaging"},{"lang":["fre"],"value":"Scintigraphy"}],"articleId":["26"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6H6-GWT7F60B-Z","language":["fre"],"originalGenre":["Short survey"],"abstract":"R\u00e9sum\u00e9: Depuis longtemps, la radioactivit\u00e9 \u03b2 est utilis\u00e9e pour le marquage et le suivi de mol\u00e9cules impliqu\u00e9es dans des m\u00e9canismes biologiques. L\u2019imagerie \u03b2 est obtenue par autoradiographie. La technique classique sur film ou \u00e9mulsions photographiques est aujourd\u2019hui supplant\u00e9e par des radio-imageurs tr\u00e8s performants. Le phophor-imageur, le \u03b2-imageur et le \u03bc-imageur sont les dispositifs les plus utilis\u00e9s aujourd\u2019hui. Leur principe de fonctionnement et leurs propri\u00e9t\u00e9s sont compar\u00e9es. Les principaux avantages de ces radio-imageurs sont la rapidit\u00e9 d\u2019obtention des r\u00e9sultats et leur fiabilit\u00e9 pour la quantification absolue. Tous les \u00e9metteurs (\u03b2-,\u03b2--\u03b3 et \u03b2+) sont d\u00e9tectables ainsi que les traceurs \u03b3 de m\u00e9decine nucl\u00e9aire gr\u00e2ce aux \u00e9lectrons de faible \u00e9nergie lib\u00e9r\u00e9s au cours de l\u2019\u00e9mission \u03b3. Le phosphor-imageur est bien adapt\u00e9 aux traceurs de forte \u00e9nergie et aux grandes s\u00e9ries de mesures. Les radio-imageurs temps r\u00e9els (\u03b2-imageur et \u03bc-imageur) sont pr\u00e9f\u00e9r\u00e9s pour la v\u00e9rification des conditions d\u2019exp\u00e9rience. Le \u03b2-imageur et le \u03bc-imageur sont souvent compl\u00e9mentaires, l\u2019un offrant un grand champ d\u2019analyse avec une r\u00e9solution moyenne et l\u2019autre une excellente r\u00e9solution, mais avec une surface d\u2019analyse faible. Leurs nombreuses applications en biologie mol\u00e9culaire (blotting, expression des g\u00e8nes) et en physiopathologie (liaison, hybridation in situ, immunohistochimie) sont bien connues. Actuellement d\u2019autres applications sont \u00e9tudi\u00e9es en imagerie mol\u00e9culaire. De plus, les possibilit\u00e9s d\u2019imagerie en multi-isotopes ouvrent des horizons nouveaux aux chercheurs, en particulier en m\u00e9decine nucl\u00e9aire.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":47,"sectionCount":14,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":1,"level":0},{"sectionCount":4,"level":1},{"sectionCount":5,"level":2},{"sectionCount":4,"level":3}],"sectionDepth":4,"imageCount":9,"tableCount":0,"refCount":12},"tdmReady":true,"score":8.307,"pdfWordCount":5742,"pdfCharCount":33400,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":9,"pdfPageSize":"595.276 x 793.701 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":638,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":220,"abstractCharCount":1614,"keywordCount":10},"title":"L\u2019imagerie b\u00eata haute r\u00e9solution","hasFormula":false,"pii":["S0928-1258(07)00027-7"],"refBibs":[{"author":[{"name":"A Coquerel"},{"name":"F Chevallier"},{"name":"N Zs\u00fcrger"}],"host":{"volume":"4","pages":{"last":"23","first":"8"},"title":"ACOMEN","publicationDate":"1996"},"title":"Imagerie in vitro par les radioimageurs. {"corpusName":"wiley","keywords":{"teeft":["valeurs","patrimoine","sont","comme","beaute","patrimoniale","cette","aussi","elle","heinich","objet","rarete","axiologique","selon","singularite","peut","european association","social anthropologist","ainsi","leur","soit","entre","faire","registre","communaute","donc","temp","avec","pragmatique","moins","laquelle","registres","patrimoniales","patrimonial","contexte","fait","valorise","travail","amplificateurs","authenticite","commun","elles","vers","chercheur","maison","permet","sociologie","acteurs","personne","dont","puis","livet","celui","sociologue","monument historiques","dire","scientifique","grammaire axiologique","anthropologist","science sociales","performance axiologique","veux dire","soit vers","sans"]},"author":[{"name":"Nathalie Heinich"}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Communaut\u00e9"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"\u00e9motions"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"patrimoine"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"singularit\u00e9"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"pragmatisme"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"valeurs"}],"articleId":["SOCA187"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-6W62TKQ8-C","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"L\u2019objet patrimonial suscite des \u00e9motions, qui peuvent \u00eatre d\u00e9crites selon leur signe (positif ou n\u00e9gatif), leur contexte (individuel ou collectif, priv\u00e9 ou public), ou les valeurs qu\u2019elles manifestent (authenticit\u00e9, pr\u00e9sence, beaut\u00e9), relevant chacune d\u2019un \u00abregistre de valeurs\u00bb sp\u00e9cifique, amplifi\u00e9es selon deux axes d\u2019extensibilit\u00e9 (temporel, avec l\u2019anciennet\u00e9, et spatial, avec la raret\u00e9), d\u00e9pendant de deux \u00abr\u00e9gimes de qualification\u00bb (communaut\u00e9 et singularit\u00e9). Cette architecture conceptuelle, construite inductivement gr\u00e2ce \u00e0 l\u2019approche pragmatique, permet de d\u00e9finir ce qui autorise la mise en patrimoine, et de comprendre pourquoi l\u2019objet patrimonial suscite de telles \u00e9preuves \u00e9motionnelles, r\u00e9v\u00e9lant et r\u00e9activant les valeurs qui lui sont associ\u00e9es.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":60,"sectionCount":10,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":10}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":4,"tableCount":0,"refCount":28},"tdmReady":true,"score":6.855,"pdfWordCount":8111,"pdfCharCount":46155,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":15,"pdfPageSize":"484.673 x 697.323 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":541,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":99,"abstractCharCount":760,"keywordCount":6},"title":"Les emotions patrimoniales: de l\u2019affect a l\u2019axiologie","hasFormula":false,"genre":["article"],"host":{"title":"Social Anthropology","language":["unknown"],"doi":["10.1111/(ISSN)1469-8676"],"issn":["0964-0282"],"eissn":["1469-8676"],"publisherId":["SOCA"],"volume":"20","issue":"1","pages":{"first":"19","last":"33","total":"15"},"genre":["journal"]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"persName":["L. {"corpusName":"wiley","keywords":{"teeft":["lemur","chromosome","macaco","propithecus","madagascan","madagascar","lemur macaco","hybrid","madagascan lemur","specie","subspecies","lemur group","hybrid male","primate","chromosome formula","home range","neighbouring group","different form","long time","different specie","geographical distribution","chromosome number","eastern form","lemur rubriventer","same size","buettner janusch","white ear","cheirogaleus major","microcebus murinus","black head","lemur population","lemur rubtiventer","wide distribution","high ground","territorial behaviour","different member","primate evolution"]},"author":[{"name":"J. J. PETTER","affiliations":["Laboratoire d'Ecologie du Museum de Paris, Brunoy"]}],"articleId":["BIJ77"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-MCR6P0DK-W","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"Nous nous sommes efforc\u00e9s depuis 1957, date de nos premi\u00e8res recherches \u00e0 Madagascar, de preciser les caract\u00e8res systematiques des diff\u00e9rentes esp\u00e8ces de L\u00e9muriens. Sans minimiser l'importance des crit\u00e8res morphologiques, nous nous sommes jusqu'\u00e0 maintenant appliqu\u00e9s, par des \u00e9tudes \u00e9co\u2010\u00e9thologiques de mieux conna\u00eetre les diff\u00e9rentes formes existantes et de pr\u00e9ciser leurs caract\u00e8res distinctifs. Les \u00e9tudes ont \u00e9x\u00e9 men\u00e9es sur le terrain au cours de plusieurs missions et en captivit\u00e9 dans la station de recherche de Tananarive et au Laboratoire de Brunoy, en France. C'est ainsi que nos \u00e9tudes nous ont amen\u00e9\u00e0 revenir, par exemple, pour les L\u00e9murs, \u00e0 la classification de Schwarz groupant en une seule esp\u00e8ce toute une s\u00e9rie de formes de Lemur et \u00e0 les consid\u00e9rer comme des sous\u2010esp\u00e8ces de l'esp\u00e8ce Lemur macaco. Les recherches sur les chromosomes faites par plusieurs chercheurs ces derni\u00e8res ann\u00e9es soul\u2010\u00e9vent cependant quelques probl\u00e8mes car on a trouv\u00e9 des formules chromosomiques diff\u00e9rentes pour des animaux fort semblables \u00e0 beaucoup de points de vue. Nous avons church\u00e9 tous les cas d'hybrides connus et tent\u00e9 nous\u2010m\u00eames, et avec R. Albignac chercheur de l'O.R.S.T.O.M. a Tananarive de r\u00e9aliser toutes les hybridations possibles en captivit\u00e9. C'est un aper\u00e7u de ces recherches en cours que nous avons voulu exposer, ainsi que quelques observations nouvelles sur les hybrides obtenus. L'\u00e9volution des esp\u00e8ces le plus souvent sociales et territoriales posent des probl\u00e8mes tr\u00e8s inter\u2010essants et Madagascar nous offre encore \u00e0 ce point de vue un champ d'\u00e9tude privil\u00e9ge qu'il faut utiliser avant qu'il ne soit trop tard \u00e0 cause des destructions de plus en plus rapides du milieu forestier. Nous avons ainsi pu faire quelques observations dans la nature, notamment sur la variabilit\u00e9 au sein des groupes, qui nous permettent \u00e0 faire quelques hypoth\u00e8ses sur les m\u00e9canismes de l'\u00e9volution des L\u00e9muriens \u00e0 Madagascar. II semble que le territorialisme de la plupart des L\u00e9muriens favorise la formation d'homozygotes ce qui a peut\u2010\u00eatre pour cons\u00e9quence d'acc\u00e9l\u00e9rer la sp\u00e9ciation. Beaucoup de questions concernant de nombreuses esp\u00e8ces restent cependant encore sans r\u00e9ponse et il faut se garder de trop vouloir d\u00e9duire des observations fragmentaires que nous poss\u00e8dons. Des \u00e9tudes plus pouss\u00e9es sur le terrain et particuli\u00e8rement dans certaines r\u00e9gions qui servent de limites \u00e0 des sous\u2010esp\u00e8ces nous paraissent inter\u00e9ssantes \u00e0 encourager dans l'avenir pour avoir une id\u00e9e plus pr\u00e9cise de l'\u00e9volution du groupe.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":1}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":11},"tdmReady":false,"score":8.846,"pdfWordCount":3846,"pdfCharCount":20086,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":9,"pdfPageSize":"504 x 720 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":427,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":378,"abstractCharCount":2511,"keywordCount":0},"title":"Speciation in Madagascan Lemurs","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"author":[{"name":"J.
