This article provides an initial analysis of the motives and organizational pressures involved in these attempts to integrate and articulate academic research, artistic creation and industrial production in a perspective of competitiveness in innovation. It draws on the results of a survey conducted with artist\u2010researchers who created a Canadian organizational prototype of these partnerships: the Hexagram inter\u2010university consortium (Montr\u00e9al, Canada). Les \u2190 syst\u00e8mes d'innovation nationaux \u2192 engagent dans la fili\u00e8re universitaire des arts technologiques une reconfiguration des organisations de recherche et de cr\u00e9ation. Ces derni\u00e8res visent la mise sur le march\u00e9 de produits hybrides orient\u00e9s d\u00e9sormais concurremment vers une exposition artistique, une valorisation scientifique et une application au sens commercial et industriel du terme. L'article propose une premi\u00e8re analyse des ressorts et tensions organisationnelles de ces tentatives d'int\u00e9gration et d'articulation de la recherche universitaire, de la cr\u00e9ation artistique et de la production industrielle dans une perspective de concurrence \u00e0 l'innovation. Il mobilise les r\u00e9sultats d'une enqu\u00eate men\u00e9e aupr\u00e8s de chercheurs\u2010cr\u00e9ateurs d'un prototype canadien d'organisation de ces rapprochements: le consortium interuniversitaire Hexagram (Montr\u00e9al, Canada).","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":1}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":37},"tdmReady":false,"score":8.331,"pdfWordCount":7610,"pdfCharCount":45638,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":18,"pdfPageSize":"432 x 647.759 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":423,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":222,"abstractCharCount":1676,"keywordCount":0},"title":"Gouverner l'innovation, entre sciences dures et arts plastiques: le consortium interuniversitaire Hexagram (Montr\u00e9al, Canada)","hasFormula":false,"genre":["article"],"host":{"title":"Canadian Review of Sociology/Revue canadienne de sociologie","language":["unknown"],"doi":["10.1111/(ISSN)1755-618X"],"issn":["1755-6171"],"eissn":["1755-618X"],"publisherId":["CARS"],"volume":"44","issue":"4","pages":{"first":"397","last":"414","total":"18"},"genre":["journal"]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"orgName":["Division of Expert Labor","Innovitech","Cambridge University","National System of Innovation","University of Chicago Press","Harvard University","Technological Systems","In National System of Innovation"],"persName":["Law","Griesemer","J. {"corpusName":"elsevier","author":[{"name":"J.P Meningaud","affiliations":["E-mail: meningaud@noos.fr","Service de chirurgie maxillofaciale et chirurgie plastique et reconstructrice, CHI de Villeneuve Saint-Georges, 40, all\u00e9e de la Source, 94195 Villeneuve Saint-Georges cedex, France"]},{"name":"J.M Servant","affiliations":["Service de chirurgie plastique, h\u00f4pital Saint-Louis, 1, rue Claude-Vellefaux, 75475 Paris cedex 10, France"]}],"articleId":["39"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6H6-3SB6K76V-H","language":["fre"],"originalGenre":["Full-length article"],"abstract":"R\u00e9sum\u00e9: Objectif. \u2013 La qualit\u00e9 m\u00e9thodologique et \u00e9thique des articles scientifiques concernant la chirurgie esth\u00e9tique a souvent \u00e9t\u00e9 sujette \u00e0 caution. C\u2019est pourquoi nous avons propos\u00e9 \u00e0 travers une large consultation, de concevoir une grille d\u2019appr\u00e9ciation des publications scientifiques de chirurgie esth\u00e9tique dans ces domaines. M\u00e9thode. \u2013 Un questionnaire a \u00e9t\u00e9 adress\u00e9 par courrier \u00e0 40\u00a0chirurgiens plasticiens et/ou maxillofaciaux fran\u00e7ais. Le questionnaire volontairement simple comprenait 2\u00a0questions ouvertes et une invitation \u00e0 livrer sa r\u00e9flexion sur le sujet. La premi\u00e8re question \u00e9tait formul\u00e9e ainsi\u00a0: \u00ab\u00a0Veuillez \u00e9num\u00e9rer sans les d\u00e9crire vos 10\u00a0crit\u00e8res m\u00e9thodologiques essentiels lorsque vous d\u00e9cidez d\u2019\u00e9valuer une publication scientifique ayant trait \u00e0 la chirurgie esth\u00e9tique\u00a0\u00bb. La deuxi\u00e8me question \u00e9tait formul\u00e9e exactement de la m\u00eame fa\u00e7on sous r\u00e9serve du mot \u00ab\u00a0m\u00e9thodologiques\u00a0\u00bb qui \u00e9tait remplac\u00e9 par le mot \u00ab\u00a0\u00e9thiques\u00a0\u00bb. R\u00e9sultats. \u2013 Sur le plan m\u00e9thodologique, nos r\u00e9sultats se confondent avec les crit\u00e8res classiques qui permettent de r\u00e9pondre aux questions suivantes\u00a0: qu\u2019avez-vous fait\u00a0? Pourquoi l\u2019avez-vous fait\u00a0? Comment l\u2019avez-vous fait\u00a0? Qu\u2019avez-vous trouv\u00e9\u00a0? Que signifie cette d\u00e9couverte\u00a0? Quelles directions pour l\u2019avenir apr\u00e8s cette d\u00e9couverte\u00a0? En somme, restriction faite de l\u2019importance donn\u00e9e \u00e0 la comparabilit\u00e9 avant/apr\u00e8s de l\u2019iconographie, ils ne se distinguent pas fondamentalement des crit\u00e8res m\u00e9thodologiques de toute \u00e9tude qui se pr\u00e9tend scientifique. Sur le plan \u00e9thique, par ordre de citation d\u00e9croissant, on retrouve\u00a0: le rapport b\u00e9n\u00e9fice/risque, la probit\u00e9 de l\u2019auteur, le respect de la clause d\u2019\u00e9quivalence a priori, la transparence sur les conflits d\u2019int\u00e9r\u00eat, la qualit\u00e9 de l\u2019iconographie, le respect de la l\u00e9gislation, la transparence sur le travail effectif de chaque auteur, l\u2019existence de r\u00e8gles d\u2019arr\u00eat pr\u00e9coce de l\u2019\u00e9tude et la transparence sur les pr\u00e9requis animaux. Conclusion. \u2013 De la m\u00eame fa\u00e7on que depuis longtemps une \u00e9tude peut \u00eatre refus\u00e9e pour ses insuffisances m\u00e9thodologiques, elle peut l\u2019\u00eatre chaque jour davantage pour ses insuffisances en mati\u00e8re d\u2019\u00e9thique.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":42,"sectionCount":19,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":3,"level":0},{"sectionCount":5,"level":1},{"sectionCount":2,"level":2},{"sectionCount":9,"level":3}],"sectionDepth":4,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":2,"refCount":11},"tdmReady":true,"score":8,"pdfWordCount":6279,"pdfCharCount":35212,"pdfVersion":1.3,"pdfPageCount":7,"pdfPageSize":"612 La soci\u00e9t\u00e9 du risque, les lieux de diffusion des savoirs scientifiques, les axes prioritaires du financement public et les structures institutionnelles encadrant la pratique des chercheurs forment une conjoncture singuli\u00e8re o\u00f9 a pu s'\u00e9laborer un v\u00e9ritable langage des \u201cjeunes \u00e0 risque.\u201d Fruit d'une d\u00e9marche de r\u00e9flexivit\u00e9 critique, l'analyse souligne la responsabilit\u00e9 des chercheurs dans la l\u00e9gitimation de ce langage probl\u00e9matique et les d\u00e9fis que comporte le projet de le transformer. Based on governmentality studies, this article sketches out a genealogy of the \u201cyouth at\u2010risk\u201d category in contemporary youth studies. A convergence of risk society, sites of dissemination for youth research, state priorities in research funding, and institutional structures that frame research practices serve to create a unique historical moment for the emergence of regulatory \u201cyouth at\u2010risk\u201d language. As part of a critical reflexive approach to youth research, this article underscores youth scholars' responsibility to challenge this problematic language and pins down some of the difficulties this project faces in the academy.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":50,"sectionCount":9,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":5},{"level":1,"sectionCount":4}],"sectionDepth":2,"imageCount":2,"tableCount":0,"refCount":47},"tdmReady":true,"score":7.28,"pdfWordCount":9348,"pdfCharCount":56823,"pdfVersion":1.3,"pdfPageCount":23,"pdfPageSize":"387 x 594 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":406,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":190,"abstractCharCount":1309,"keywordCount":0},"title":"\u201cJeunes \u00e0 risque\u201d: G\u00e9n\u00e9alogie d'un langage probl\u00e9matique","hasFormula":false,"genre":["article"],"host":{"title":"Canadian Review of Sociology/Revue canadienne de sociologie","language":["unknown"],"doi":["10.1111/(ISSN)1755-618X"],"issn":["1755-6171"],"eissn":["1755-618X"],"publisherId":["CARS"],"volume":"50","issue":"4","pages":{"first":"430","last":"452","total":"23"},"genre":["journal"],"subject":[{"value":"ARTICLE"},{"value":"ARTICLES"}]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"placeName":["New Childhood"]}},"ark":["ark:/67375/WNG-H0VC2ZMD-8"],"categories":{"wos":["1 - social science","2 - sociology"],"scienceMetrix":[],"scopus":["1 - Social Sciences","2 - Social Sciences","3 - General Social Sciences","1 - Social Sciences","2 - Arts and Humanities","3 - Arts and Humanities (miscellaneous)"]},"publicationDate":"2013","copyrightDate":"2013","enrichments":{"type":["multicat","teeft","unitex"]},"doi":["10.1111/cars.12027"]}

Particular views about prolonged or observational interviews: This article attempts to describe the methodological aspects of what is called \u00ab socio-anthropological \u00bb research. It describes the process of \"rapprochement\" between observation and interviewing in certain research protocols in the context of contemporary societies, particularly in the case of in-depth interviews : interviews over a long period of time with the same person. Comparing the diachronic and synchronic approches of these studies with extended interviews, as presented in several r\u00e9cents books, we can say that the distinction betwen qualitative sociology and anthropology in modern research fields loses its relevance. The cons\u00e9quence of this sociological and anthropological overlap is the cr\u00e9ation of a new field of human sciences, and perhaps a new paradigm or discipline.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":0,"sectionCount":0,"sectionLevels":[],"sectionDepth":0,"imageCount":1,"tableCount":2,"refCount":34},"tdmReady":false,"score":7.227,"pdfWordCount":6863,"pdfCharCount":41250,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":19,"pdfPageSize":"384 x 609 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":361,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":130,"abstractCharCount":908,"keywordCount":3},"title":"La \u00ab Socio-Anthropologie \u00bb : Champ, paradigme ou discipline ? L\u2019utilisation d\u2019un simulateur pourrait faciliter l\u2019apprentissage professionnel. La conception d\u2019un simulateur adapt\u00e9 n\u00e9cessite une analyse des situations professionnelles.Nous avons utilis\u00e9 conjointement un syst\u00e8me d\u2019enregistrement des gestes de kin\u00e9sith\u00e9rapeutes experts lors d\u2019une s\u00e9ance de kin\u00e9sith\u00e9rapie respiratoire et un enregistrement vid\u00e9o, afin de donner un cadre de r\u00e9f\u00e9rence aux gestes kin\u00e9sith\u00e9rapiques et d\u2019identifier les concepts mobilis\u00e9s dans l\u2019action. Il appara\u00eet que les kin\u00e9sith\u00e9rapeutes experts utilisent une d\u00e9marche hypoth\u00e9tico-d\u00e9ductive pour structurer leur action \u00e0 partir d\u2019indicateurs sp\u00e9cifiquement kin\u00e9sith\u00e9rapiques. Cette d\u00e9marche de raisonnement devrait \u00eatre enseign\u00e9e pour am\u00e9liorer la qualit\u00e9 des soins. Ceci a permis d\u2019envisager un mod\u00e8le adapt\u00e9 \u00e0 la cr\u00e9ation d\u2019un environnement m\u00e9catronique pour l\u2019apprentissage humain.Niveau de preuve : non Elle a \u00e9t\u00e9 r\u00e9alis\u00e9e par analyse de donn\u00e9es des dossiers m\u00e9dicaux et par la soumission de deux questionnaires, l\u2019un explorant la qualit\u00e9 de vie (VSP-A), l\u2019autre la pr\u00e9sence de sympt\u00f4mes d\u00e9pressifs (CES-D).R\u00e9sultats. \u2013 Les r\u00e9sultats ont montr\u00e9 que ces adolescents \u00e9taient en bonne sant\u00e9 physique et avaient un score global de qualit\u00e9 de vie de 62 (DS =\u00a011.2)\u00a0; 17\u00a0% des adolescents pr\u00e9sentaient des sympt\u00f4mes d\u00e9pressifs importants (score \u2265\u00a024). Il existait une corr\u00e9lation n\u00e9gative importante et significative entre\u00a0: les scores de QV et de d\u00e9pression (r=\u00a0\u20130,680, p <\u00a00,01), la dimension psychologique de la QV et la d\u00e9pression (r=\u00a0\u20130,656, p <\u00a00,01), la dimension \u00e9nergie\u2013vitalit\u00e9 de la QV et la d\u00e9pression (r=\u00a0\u20130,763, p <\u00a00,01).Conclusion. \u2013 Une \u00e9valuation de la qualit\u00e9 de vie, approchant la sant\u00e9 mentale des adolescents de mani\u00e8re multidimensionnelle et positive, peut \u00eatre utile en m\u00e9decine scolaire pour mieux identifier les besoins sanitaires et psychosociaux des adolescents. II appara\u00eet que les effets des moments critiques de ce cycle provoquent des d\u00e9sastres de plus en plus grands (milliers d'hectares impropres \u00e0 la production, une ville baln\u00e9aire recouverte par les eaux, etc.). Des int\u00e9r\u00eats contradictoires clans la gestion des exc\u00e8s ou d\u00e9ficits en eau provoquent des conflits souvent tr\u00e8s durs et interdisent aux services de I \u00e9quipement une d\u00e9finition simple du probl\u00e8me. Nous proposons d'analyser les possibilit\u00e9s cle \u00abgestion\u00bb de ces cycles inonclations\u2014s\u00e9cheresses en consid\u00e9rant que cette situation est construite par un syst\u00e8me d'action concret compos\u00e9 des acteurs qui se forment, au fil des urgences, par la succession de catastrophes et gr\u00e2ce \u00e0 un progressif r\u00e9apprentissage de la d\u00e9mocratie au niveau local et au quotidien. Cette approche, et une conceptualisation de l'eau comme un bien ou \u00abperil\u00bb commun qui sublime les int\u00e9r\u00eats de chacun, nous permet d'evaluer les capacit\u00e9s locales de gestion de l'eau. {"corpusName":"wiley","keywords":{"teeft":["aphasia","aphasic","collaborative","phonological","impairment","conversation analysis","linguistic impairment","qualitative taking"}],"articleId":["JLCD1398"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-VCBDN5XM-L","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"This paper explores the impact of linguistic impairments on conversational ability in aphasia using conversation analysis (CA). Using a combination of quantitative and qualitative techniques, an analysis of the distribution of turns at talk in three aphasic participants' conversations with a relative and with the researcher is described. Using extracts from the conversations for illustration, three major factors are proposed which influence the sharing of conversational turns: (1) shared knowledge of interlocutors, (2) the manifestations of linguistic impairments in conversation, and (3) individual discourse styles. Finally, the implications of the findings for remediation are considered. Cette \u00e9tude utilise l'analyse de conversation pour examiner les cons\u00e9quences des troubles acquis du langage sur la capacit\u00e9 de conversation dans les cas d'aphasie. L'on se sert ici d'un m\u00e9lange de techniques qualitatives et quantitatives pour d\u00e9crire comment dans le cours de conversations trois aphasiques prennent la parole en alternance avec un parent et avec le chercheur. Cette analyse est illustr\u00e9e \u00e0 partir d'extraits des conversations, et l'on propose trois facteurs principaux qui influent sur ces alternances: (1) dans quelle mesure les interlocuteurs sont au courant des m\u00eames choses, (2) les manifestations de troubles linguistiques lors de la conversation, (3) certains styles individuels de conversation. L'on consid\u00e8re enfin les cons\u00e9quences th\u00e9rapeutiques des faits mis en \u00e9vidence. Dieser Aufsatz untersucht mithilfe der Konversationsanalyse die Auswirkung linguistischer Behinderung auf die Konversationsf\u00e4higkeit. Unter Verwendung einer Kombination quantitativer und qualitativer Methoden wird eine Analyse der Verteilung von Einzelbeitr\u00e4gen (\u2018Turns\u2019) dreier Aphasiker im Gespr\u00e4ch mit einem Verwandten und mit der Versuchsleiterin pr\u00e4sentiert. Mit Beispielen aus den Gespr\u00e4chen zur Illustration werden drei Hauptfaktoren vorgeschlagen, die die Proportion der Gespr\u00e4chsanteile beeinfl\u00fcssen: (1) das gemeinsame Wissen der Gespr\u00e4chspartner, (2) die Manifestation linguistischer Behinderung im Gespr\u00e4ch, (3) individuelle Gespr\u00e4chsstile. Die Implikationen der Ergebnisse f\u00fcr eine remediale Behandlung werden erwogen.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":1,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":1}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":0,"refCount":22},"tdmReady":false,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":295,"abstractCharCount":2228,"keywordCount":3,"score":10,"pdfWordCount":6193,"pdfCharCount":34823,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":12,"pdfPageSize":"486.239 x 687.36 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":516,"pdfText":true},"title":"Applying conversation analysis to aphasia: clinical implications and analytic issues","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"author":[{"name":"C. Sa mesure est rembours\u00e9e par la Caisse d\u2019assurance maladie en France selon des crit\u00e8res cliniques.M\u00e9thodesDans cette \u00e9tude transversale observationnelle multicentrique, nous avons estim\u00e9 la proportion de femmes m\u00e9nopaus\u00e9es atteintes d\u2019ost\u00e9oporose parmi celles adress\u00e9es pour une mesure de densit\u00e9 min\u00e9rale osseuse. Les facteurs de risque d\u2019ost\u00e9oporose ont \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9crits ainsi que les recommandations th\u00e9rapeutiques.R\u00e9sultatsSix cent quarante-six\u00a0femmes m\u00e9nopaus\u00e9es ont \u00e9t\u00e9 \u00e9valu\u00e9es. Une ost\u00e9oporose a \u00e9t\u00e9 diagnostiqu\u00e9e chez 57,6\u00a0% d\u2019entre elles, une ost\u00e9op\u00e9nie chez 38,7\u00a0% et une densit\u00e9 min\u00e9rale osseuse normale a \u00e9t\u00e9 observ\u00e9e chez 3,7\u00a0%. Les principaux facteurs de risque de fracture \u00e9taient les suivants\u00a0: ant\u00e9c\u00e9dent personnel de fracture (40\u00a0%), fracture dans la famille (23\u00a0%), tabagisme (15\u00a0%) et prise de glucocortico\u00efdes (15\u00a0%). Un m\u00e9dicament anti-ost\u00e9oporotique \u00e9tait recommand\u00e9 pour 93\u00a0% des femmes ost\u00e9oporotiques et pour 45\u00a0% des femmes ost\u00e9op\u00e9niques. Une analyse en r\u00e9gression logistique a montr\u00e9 qu\u2019un T-score=\u22122,5\u00a0\u00e9tait le facteur d\u00e9terminant de la prise de d\u00e9cision du traitement. Une analyse en cluster a identifi\u00e9 cinq\u00a0groupes de femmes selon diff\u00e9rentes combinaisons de facteurs de risque fracturaire.\u00a0Parmi des femmes m\u00e9nopaus\u00e9es adress\u00e9es pour une densit\u00e9 min\u00e9rale osseuse et r\u00e9pondant aux crit\u00e8res d\u2019intervention th\u00e9rapeutique, 96,3\u00a0% pr\u00e9sentaient une ost\u00e9oporose ou une ost\u00e9op\u00e9nie.ConclusionMalgr\u00e9 les recommandations, la prise de d\u00e9cision th\u00e9rapeutique des m\u00e9decins \u00e9tait principalement bas\u00e9e sur le r\u00e9sultat de la Gouin Ouest, Montr\u00e9al, Qu\u00e9bec, Canada H4J 1C5;"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"cortical thickness"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"voxel\u2010based morphometry"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"diffusion tensor imaging"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"neurodegenerative diseases"}],"articleId":["MDS25820"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/WNG-48KC1454-Z","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["article"],"abstract":"Idiopathic rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder is a parasomnia that is a risk factor for dementia with Lewy bodies and Parkinson's disease. Brain function impairments have been identified in this disorder, mainly in the frontal and posterior cortical regions. However, the anatomical support for these dysfunctions remains poorly understood. We investigated gray matter thickness, gray matter volume, and white matter integrity in patients with idiopathic rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder. Twenty\u2010four patients with polysomnography\u2010confirmed idiopathic rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder and 42 healthy individuals underwent a 3\u2010tesla structural and diffusion magnetic resonance imaging examination using corticometry, voxel\u2010based morphometry, and diffusion tensor imaging. In the patients with idiopathic rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder, decreased cortical thickness was observed in the frontal cortex, the lingual gyrus, and the fusiform gyrus. Gray matter volume was reduced in the superior frontal sulcus only. Patients showed no increased gray matter thickness or volume. Diffusion tensor imaging analyses revealed no significant white matter differences between groups. Using corticometry in patients with idiopathic rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder, several new cortical regions with gray matter alterations were identified, similar to those reported in dementia with Lewy bodies and Parkinson's disease. These findings provide some anatomical support for previously identified brain function impairments in this disorder. \u00a9 2014 International Parkinson and Movement Disorder Society","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":46,"sectionCount":16,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":6},{"level":1,"sectionCount":6},{"level":2,"sectionCount":4}],"sectionDepth":3,"imageCount":4,"tableCount":3,"refCount":50},"tdmReady":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":221,"abstractCharCount":1636,"keywordCount":5,"score":8.985,"pdfWordCount":5664,"pdfCharCount":32582,"pdfVersion":1.5,"pdfPageCount":8,"pdfPageSize":"612 x 809.972 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":708,"pdfText":true},"title":"Patterns of cortical thinning in idiopathic rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder","hasFormula":false,"genre":["article"],"host":{"title":"Movement Disorders","language":["unknown"],"doi":["10.1002/(ISSN)1531-8257"],"issn":["0885-3185"],"eissn":["1531-8257"],"publisherId":["MDS"],"volume":"30","issue":"5","pages":{"first":"680","last":"687","total":"9"},"genre":["journal"],"subject":[{"value":"Research Article"},{"value":"Research Articles"}]},"namedEntities":{"unitex":{"orgName":["Engineering Research Council of Canada","Health Research, the Natural Sciences","Brain Imaging Center","Weston Foundation, and the Drummond Foundation","Engineering Research Council","Health Research and the Fonds","Organization","Engineering Research Council, and Fonds","International Consortium for Brain Mapping","Research Project","IBM Corporation"],"persName":["Dr. Joubert","A. Une telle analyse serait particuli\u00e8rement utile en contexte de collaboration interorganisationnelle (ci) compte tenu du niveau de complexit\u00e9 de ce type de partenariat. Cependant, les recherches ont g\u00e9n\u00e9ralement accord\u00e9 peu d\u2019attention \u00e0 la perception qu\u2019ont les acteurs du succ\u00e8s de leur ci. L\u2019objectif de la pr\u00e9sente recherche est de montrer que la cartographie cognitive, comme outil mis au service de la gestion des connaissances, peut enrichir notre compr\u00e9hension du succ\u00e8s des ci. On verra ici comment la cartographie cognitive permet de d\u00e9gager les similitudes et les divergences dans la mani\u00e8re dont les acteurs issus de deux organisations li\u00e9es par une entente de partenariat dans le domaine de la r\u00e9adaptation au travail structurent leur repr\u00e9sentation du succ\u00e8s de leur collaboration. Huit participants ont \u00e9t\u00e9 invit\u00e9s \u00e0 d\u00e9terminer de mani\u00e8re autonome les concepts et les liens de leur carte cognitive sur le sujet, \u00e0 l\u2019aide d\u2019un guide d\u00e9velopp\u00e9 \u00e0 cette fin. L\u2019analyse comparative des cartes individuelles a \u00e9t\u00e9 r\u00e9alis\u00e9e \u00e0 l\u2019aide du logiciel Decision Explorer et a port\u00e9 sur l\u2019importance relative des concepts y figurant, sur l\u2019\u00e9tude des facteurs consid\u00e9r\u00e9s comme des \u00abexplications\u00bb ou des \u00abcons\u00e9quences\u00bb privil\u00e9gi\u00e9es ainsi que sur les caract\u00e9ristiques des groupes \u00e9mergeant d\u2019une analyse de regroupement (cluster analysis). Les r\u00e9sultats ont mis en relief, entre autres, la grande diversit\u00e9 intra et interorganisationnelle des repr\u00e9sentations d\u2019une bonne collaboration. Malgr\u00e9 cette diversit\u00e9, les acteurs accordent une place centrale \u00e0 la communication entre les partenaires et au succ\u00e8s de leur intervention aupr\u00e8s du patient. Cette recherche a aussi montr\u00e9 qu\u2019il \u00e9tait possible pour les sujets de d\u00e9terminer les concepts et les liens de leur carte cognitive sans l\u2019accompagnement intensif du chercheur, ce qui constitue une premi\u00e8re dans le domaine de la cartographie cognitive.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":40,"sectionCount":17,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":17,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":6,"tableCount":5,"refCount":36},"tdmReady":true,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":300,"abstractCharCount":2046,"keywordCount":16,"score":8.667,"pdfWordCount":9680,"pdfCharCount":53970,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":22,"pdfPageSize":"453.6 x 691.68 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":440,"pdfText":true},"title":"Gestion de la connaissance et cartographie cognitive: une \u00e9tude sur la collaboration interorganisationnelle","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"volume":"36","pages":{"last":"13","first":"1"},"title":"European Journal of Operational Research","publicationDate":"1988"},"title":"Cognitive mapping: A review"},{"host":{"title":"ACKERMANN (F. )"},"title":"Analyzing and comparing idiographic causal maps"},{"author":[{"name":"Spender"}],"host":{"title":"Sage","publicationDate":"1998"},"title":"Managerial and organizational cognition"},{"author":[{"name":"Bougon (m G ) Weick"},{"name":"( K E"}],"host":{"volume":"22","pages":{"last":"639","first":"608"},"title":"BINKHORST, (D.)","publicationDate":"1977"},"title":"Cognition in organization: An analysis of the Utrecht Jazz Orchestra"},{"host":{"volume":"29","pages":{"last":"389","first":"369"},"issue":"3","title":"Journal of Management Studies","publicationDate":"1992"},"title":"Congregate cognitive maps: A unified dynamic theory of organization and strategy"},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"Audet (m.) {"corpusName":"cambridge","author":[{"name":"Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Lesemann","affiliations":["Institut national de la recherche scientifique (INRS), Culture et Soci\u00e9t\u00e9","E-mail: Frederic.Lesemann@inrs-culture.uquebec.ca"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Aging"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Social Policy"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Social Sciences"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Canada"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"1980\u20132000"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Vieillissement"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"politiques sociales"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"sciences sociales"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Canada"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"1980\u20132000"}],"articleId":["01519"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/6GQ-PDXMXHST-P","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"This article is an essay, based on the attempted assessment ofresearch in the social sciences on aging in Canada and in Quebec during the last 20 years. It endeavours o t understand this area as based on institutional factors, including linguistic, cultural and political divisions between English Canada and Quebec, and the role of some major forces. Canadian research on aging is profoundly based on a social democratic vision of the role of the State that establishes the basic concept of citizenship, rights, liberties, justice and equality. It consequently contributes to maintaining the protective, redistributive, regulatory andcorrection ofinequalities that the State carries out through its social and fiscal policies. In the space of 20 years, the social sciences of aging in Canada have gone from a representation of aging characterized by decline, unavoidable physical and often psychic deterioration of capacities, impoverishment, and exclusion to a much more qualified vision of aging distinguished by the search for autonomy, adaptation, and growth in which seniors do not succumb passively to their condition but rather become responsible for their own development. At the same time, researchers, as well as experts and decision makers in the area ofaging, have turned progressively from an analysis of aging centred on social problems and the programs aimed to meet these problems, which encouraged the development of the state as provider, to an analysis of the forces and resources which seniors have or could obtain to rekindle family or community solidarities with the goal of maximum promotion of the autonomy of older persons.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":42,"sectionCount":6,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":6,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":3,"tableCount":6,"refCount":40},"tdmReady":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":255,"abstractCharCount":1649,"keywordCount":10,"score":10,"pdfWordCount":15309,"pdfCharCount":88071,"pdfVersion":1.6,"pdfPageCount":33,"pdfPageSize":"439.2 x 691.2 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":464,"pdfText":true},"title":"Vingt ann\u00e9es de sciences sociales du vieillissement au Canada: un essai d'interpr\u00e9tation","hasFormula":false,"pii":["S0714980800015191"],"refBibs":[{"author":[{"name":"W &apos;essor D&apos;une Gerontologie Canadienne ; V"},{"name":"Marshall"}],"host":{"editor":"de F. consider two approaches to the interpretation of EPG data, using materials designed for the investigation of [s]\u2010[\u222b] assimilations across word boundaries, as in boss Shep. A contact index is based on electrode contact in different row groups, whereas a neural network is used to determine patterns of contact. Both approaches are speaker sensitive, reflecting the wide variation in [s] and [\u222b] articulation between speakers. The advantage of the neural net analysis is that the investigator need not make any assumptions about the relative value of specific electrodes or groups of electrodes. We found that the \u2018hand\u2010selected\u2019 index, in general, modelled linguopalatal movement for all degrees of [s]\u2013[\u222b] assimilation better than the neural net. However, the neural net very successfully characterised stable /s/ and /\u222b/ and has the potential to give an accurate representation of intermediate assimilatory cases, if trained on a more varied input set than the rather limited one used in this experiment. Nous consid\u00e9rons deux modes d'investigations pour l'interpr\u00e9tation de donn\u00e9es \u00e9lectropalatographiques, en faisant appel \u00e0 des mat\u00e9riaux mis au point pour l'examen des assimilations entre [s] et [\u222b] \u00e0 la chami\u00e8re des mots, comme en anglais boss Shep. Une d\u00e9finition est donn\u00e9e d'un indice de contact, bas\u00e9 sur des contacts d'\u00e9lectrodes organis\u00e9es selon diff\u00e9rents groupes de rang\u00e9es; en me&#x030a;me temps un r\u00e9seau neuronal est utilis\u00e9 pour d\u00e9terminer les types de contact. Les deux modes d'investigation sont sensibles aux caract\u00e9ristiques propres des locuteurs, et refl\u00e8tent les variations consid\u00e9rables dans l'articulation de [s] et [\u222b] entre locuteurs. L'avantage de l'analyse par r\u00e9seaux neuraux est que le chercheur n'a pas besoin de faire d'hypoth\u00e8ses sur la valeur relative d'\u00e9lectrodes ou groupes d'\u00e9lectrodes particuliers. Nous avons trouv\u00e9 qu'en g\u00e9n\u00e9ral l'indice \u2018s\u00e9lectionn\u00e9 manuellement\u2019 reproduisait les mouvements linguo\u2010palataux pour tous les degr\u00e9s d'assimilations entre /s/ et /\u222b/ mieux que le r\u00e9seau neuronal. Malgr\u00e9 tout le r\u00e9seau neuronal r\u00e9ussissait particuli\u00e8rement \u00e0 caract\u00e9riser les /s/ et /\u222b/ stables, et il a la capacit\u00e9 de fournir une repr\u00e9sentation exacte des cas d'assimilation interm\u00e9diaires, pour peu qu'on le branche sur un groupe de donn\u00e9es plus vari\u00e9es que celles, plut&#x006f;&#x030a;t limit\u00e9es, qui ont \u00e9t\u00e9 utilis\u00e9es dans cette exp\u00e9rience. Es werden zwei Ans\u00e4tze zur Interpretation von EPG\u2010Daten verglichen. Die Experimentaldaten werden einer Unterschuchung von [s]\u2013[\u222b]\u2010Assimilation an Wortgrenzen wie in boss Shep entnommen. Beide Ans\u00e4tze sind sprechersensitiv, was die gro***\u00dfe Variation an [s] und [\u222b]\u2010Artikulationen zwischen den men \u00fcber die relative Bedeutung spezifischer Elektroden oder Elektrodengruppen gemacht werden m\u00fcssen. {"corpusName":"springer-journals","author":[{"name":"Andr\u00e9 Julien"}],"articleId":["BF03013868","Art1"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/1BB-N96WLKB4-S","language":["fre"],"originalGenre":["OriginalPaper"],"abstract":"Sommaire: L'auteur \u00e9tudie l'\u00e9volution du bureau manuel r\u00e9gional de Paris depuis sa mise en service jusqu'\u00e0 l'\u00e9poque actuelle. De simple bureau de d\u00e9part vers la zone suburbaine n'utilisant que des circuits \u00e0 batterie centrale, analogues \u00e0 des lignes auxiliaires, le R\u00e9gional est d'abord devenu un deuxi\u00e8me central interurbain desservant toute la Seine-et-Oise dans les deux sens au moyen de circuits du type classique non aliment\u00e9s. L'accoroissement continu du trafic, a pr\u00e8s avoir entra\u00een\u00e9 une extension parall\u00e8le des installations, a conduit ensuite \u00e0 rechercher un meilleur rendement du central en simplifiant le plus possible les man\u0153uvres des op\u00e9ratrices. Le plus grand progr\u00e8s dans ce sens, apr\u00e8s l'adoption d\u00e8s l'origine du bureau de l'exploitation sans rappel syst\u00e9matique du demandeur, a r\u00e9sult\u00e9 de l'imputation directe de la taxe au compteur du demandeur, ce qui a r\u00e9duit l'\u00e9tablissement des fiches pour la comptabilit\u00e9 aux seuls cas o\u00f9 la communicatian de d\u00e9part ne peut \u00eatre imm\u00e9diatement \u00e9tablie. Enfin l'augmentation de la capacit\u00e9 d'\u00e9coulement du bureau, cons\u00e9quence d'une part de l'extension de ses installations jusqu'\u00e0 saturation compl\u00e8te de l'immeuble et d'autre part de la g\u00e9n\u00e9ralisation de m\u00e9thodes d'exploitation acc\u00e9l\u00e9l\u00e9r\u00e9es, permet d'envisager dans un avenir prochain l'extension de la zone g\u00e9ographique desservie par le R\u00e9gional en y adjoignant progressivement plusieurs d\u00e9partements voisins de Paris actuellement desservis par le central ALLIRAND","affiliations":["U.R. de Bioclimatologie, INRA, F-78850, Thiverval-Grignon, France Laboratoire de Botanique, Institut des Sciences de l'Evolution, Universite\u0301 de Montpellier II et CNRS, Botanique, Institut des Sciences de l'Evolution, Universite\u0301 de Montpellier II et CNRS, Place Euge\u0300ne Bataillon, F-34095, Montpellier, Cedex, France"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Plant architecture"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"development"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"maize (Zea mays L.)"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"tillering"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"branching"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"shoot"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"prolificacy"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"phyllochron."}],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/HXZ-BVP8QW9H-6","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"The maximal architectural development of a modern maize cultivar (Zea mays L. \u2018Dea\u2019) was studied in fully isolated and carefully irrigated plants. Under these favourable conditions, this (usually) non-tillering and non-prolific cultivar displayed a large amount of branching (down to the third order), including large basal tillers and prolific ear shoots. This development was analysed by combining: (1) architectural analysis, initially developed for trees; and (2) quantitative analysis of tillering kinetics, designed for other grass species. The architectural unit of maize included a main long axis (A1) and lateral short shoots bearing a terminal spike (A2). The basal tillers (noted A1\u2032) resulted from a complete and sylleptic reiteration. Its kinetics were consistent with tillering models, but with a particularly long delay in branch emergence (seven phyllochrons), compared to other grass species. This delay is likely to enhance regulation by leaf (or root) density in stands and explains the inhibition of branch development, as usually observed in field conditions, even at low density. Similarly, the suppression of the basal reiteration in secondary branches observed in isolated plants probably results from increased intra-tussock density. In isolated plants, androgenous axes combining A1\u2032 and A2 morphologies were also produced in intermediate positions. It is shown that they can result from a basipetal sequence of A2 differentiation reaching buds in the course of their A1\u2032 development. The consequences of these unexpected results are discussed in terms of maize development and architectural analysis of grasses. Elle part des diverses critiques adress\u00e9es \u00e0 la recherche qualitative pour exposer diff\u00e9rentes grilles d'aide \u00e0 l'\u00e9valuation de la qualit\u00e9 d'un article et cela en fonction du point de vue qu'elles privil\u00e9gient. Elle propose une \u00ab\u00a0grille\u2013rep\u00e8re\u00a0\u00bb, synth\u00e8se de diff\u00e9rents travaux, susceptible de guider le travail des experts charg\u00e9s par les revues de l'\u00e9valuation d'un article qualitatif. Outil permettant une \u00e9valuation entre pairs qui ne sont pas toujours form\u00e9s aux sp\u00e9cificit\u00e9s des m\u00e9thodes qualitatives. Il favorise l'homog\u00e9n\u00e9isation des proc\u00e9dures d'expertises \u00e0 partir d'un accord sur des crit\u00e8res communs. L'utilisation de cette grille permet une plus grande comparabilit\u00e9 des comptes-rendus et une moindre sensibilit\u00e9 \u00e0 la seule subjectivit\u00e9 des Research Problematic"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Social Mobility."}],"articleId":["10.1177_075910639504700105"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/M70-C7ZKCNPR-3","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["research-article"],"abstract":"Methodology of Sociological Research Procedure: Didactics of a Research Project. The objective of this article is to present sociological research procedure, and, more concretely, to show that sociological investigation - even in its most technical aspects - is inseparable from theoretical considerations. The problems a researcher encounters in trying to link theoretical considerations with empirical operationalization are not really treated in sociological literature. The author presents and analyzes the three components of a problematic: the frame, the approach, the prospective. The research frame - and through it, the research object - has less sociological value the closer it is to common sense knowledge. An approach can by atemporal or chronological. A perspective is an individual researcher's theoretical position in which he expresses his scientific institutional identity. The author applies these ideas to an example of the study of social mobility.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":false,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":0,"sectionCount":0,"sectionLevels":[],"sectionDepth":0,"imageCount":0,"tableCount":4,"refCount":79},"tdmReady":false,"score":7.347,"pdfWordCount":7340,"pdfCharCount":43785,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":21,"pdfPageSize":"376 x 610 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":350,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":140,"abstractCharCount":969,"keywordCount":3},"title":"Methodologie De La Demarche De Recherche En Sociologie Didactique Du Projet De Recherche","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"pages":{"last":"82","first":"1967"},"publisher":"Popper","title":"connaissance sociologique: Bachelard (1938 et 1949)","publicationDate":"1952"}},{"host":{"title":"Ils sont souvent cit&eacute;s dans les manuels qui se penchent sur les questions les plus fondamentales"}},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"Blanchet"}],"title":"Javeau (1970) sur l'enqu&ecirc;te par questionnaire, Pag&egrave;s (1970) sur l'entretien non-directif, Caillot (1972) sur l'enqu&ecirc;te-participation en mati&egrave;re d'am&eacute;nagement. Qu\u00e9bec, Canada","E-mail: descamps-bednarz.nadine@uqam.ca"]}],"subject":[{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Ethnomath\u00e9matique"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Burkina Faso"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Cognition situ\u00e9e"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Construction en contexte"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Math\u00e9matiques de la vie quotidienne"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Approche ethnographique"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Ressources structurantes"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Ordre constitutif"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Monde exp\u00e9rientiel des acteurs"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Connaissances-en-acte"},{"lang":["eng"],"value":"Th\u00e9or\u00e8mes-en-acte"}],"articleId":["9200","s10649-009-9200-6"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/VQC-HTKPV4JB-X","language":["eng"],"originalGenre":["OriginalPaper"],"abstract":"Abstract: Mathematics teaching in Burkina Faso is faced with major challenges (high illiteracy rates, students\u2019 difficulties, and high failure rates in mathematics, which is a central topic in the curriculum). As evidenced in many of these studies, mathematics is reputed to be tough, inaccessible, and far from what students live daily. Students here look as though they are living in two seemingly distant worlds, school and everyday life. In order to better understand these difficulties and to contribute in the long run to a more adapted teaching of mathematics, we tried to document and elicit the \u201cmathematical resources\u201d mobilized in various daily life social practices. In this paper, we focus on one of them, the counting and selling of mangoes by unschooled peasants. An ethnographic approach draws on the observation of the situated activity of counting and selling mangoes (during harvesting) and on \u201celiciting interviews\u201d of the involved actors. The analysis of results highlights a richness of structuring resources mobilized and distributed through this practice, related to what Lave (1988) call \u201cthe experienced lived-in-world\u201d and \u201cconstitutive order.\u201d The mathematical resources take the form of \u201cknowledge in action\u201d and \u201ctheorems in action\u201d (Vergnaud, Rech Didact Math 10(23):133\u2013170, 1990), embedded in the social, economic, and even cultural structures of actors.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"grobid","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":38,"sectionCount":15,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":15,"level":0}],"sectionDepth":1,"imageCount":9,"tableCount":0,"refCount":48},"tdmReady":true,"refBibsNative":false,"abstractWordCount":208,"abstractCharCount":1387,"keywordCount":11,"score":7.496,"pdfWordCount":10661,"pdfCharCount":58450,"pdfVersion":1.3,"pdfPageCount":20,"pdfPageSize":"439.37 x 666.142 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":533,"pdfText":true},"title":"Math\u00e9matiques de la vie quotidienne au Burkina Faso: une analyse de la pratique sociale de comptage et de vente de mangues","hasFormula":true,"refBibs":[{"author":[{"name":"G Abreu"}],"host":{"volume":"41","pages":{"last":"29","first":"1"},"title":"Educational Studies in Mathematics","publicationDate":"2000"},"title":"Relationships between macro and micro socio-cultural contexts: Implications for the study of interactions in the mathematics classroom"},{"host":{"title":"Actes des \u00e9tats g\u00e9n\u00e9raux de l'\u00e9ducation","publicationDate":"1994"},"title":"Ouagadougou (Burkina Faso): Minist\u00e8re de l'\u00c9ducation de Base et de l'Alphab\u00e9tisation de masse (MEBA)"},{"host":{"author":[{"name":"M Ascher"}],"publisher":"Brooks/Cole","title":"Ethnomathematics: A multicultural view of mathematics ideas","publicationDate":"1991"}},{"author":[{"name":"M Ascher"},{"name":"R Ascher"}],"host":{"editor":"D. and geo\u2010legal strategies: The case of mosaic cutting along Qu\u00e9bec's national parks boundaries Since the 1980's, the province of Qu\u00e9bec has established many provincial parks (known as national parks since 2002) in order to apply conservation and protection measures to nationally significant natural areas. Some of these parks are adjacent to public forest lands where industrial logging practices are permitted. Under the terms of the 2003 law, logging operations must apply mosaic cutting practices. The regulation provides that the residual forest stands must be equal to or larger than the harvested area. Since 2004, lumber companies have been allowed to designate residual forests within national park boundaries. Using the interdisciplinary approach of legal geography, our research aims to develop a better understanding of the concept of encroachment, as well as its underlying geo\u2010legal strategies, through the public\u2010private continuum. We draw on both qualitative and legal methods to investigate three instances in which residual forests were located within national park boundaries. It is shown that geo\u2010legal strategies for residual forests are a means through which the minist\u00e8re des Ressources naturelles et de la Faune and forest products companies have encroached on national park territory.","qualityIndicators":{"hasStructuredBody":true,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"paragraphCount":68,"sectionCount":19,"sectionLevels":[{"level":0,"sectionCount":9},{"level":1,"sectionCount":10}],"sectionDepth":2,"imageCount":12,"tableCount":1,"refCount":36},"tdmReady":true,"score":8.175,"pdfWordCount":9601,"pdfCharCount":55812,"pdfVersion":1.4,"pdfPageCount":17,"pdfPageSize":"540 x 702 pts","pdfWordsPerPage":565,"pdfText":true,"refBibsNative":true,"abstractWordCount":209,"abstractCharCount":1441,"keywordCount":14},"title":"Empi\u00e8tements et strat\u00e9gies g\u00e9o\u2010l\u00e9gales: le cas de la coupe en mosa\u00efque en bordure des parcs nationaux du Qu\u00e9bec","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"publicationDate":"2000"},{"title":",","author":[{"name":"E. While the compiling and comparison of life histories, item by item, allows us to construct typologies, the analysis of internal coherence of each life history and the comparison of individual and collective logics permits us to truely treate the complexity of social phenomena and related certain seemingly contradictory processes. To establish the scientific validity of such a procedure, researchers have experimented with different approaches: discourse form analysis, identifying biographical indicators and events, cross comprehension of life histories with other materials, preceding a qualitative survey with a quantitative survey, crossing life histories between each other at the collective membership leve, contextualizing them by situating them within monographies. {"corpusName":"springer-journals","author":[{"name":"Paul A. Fortier","affiliations":["l'Universit\u00e9 de Saskatchewan,Regina Campus, Canada"]}],"articleId":["BF02402178","Art4"],"accessCondition":{"contentType":"isNotOpenAccess","value":"closed"},"arkIstex":"ark:/67375/1BB-VMV7XZKX-H","language":["fre"],"originalGenre":["OriginalPaper"],"abstract":"Abstract: This article examines only published work directly related to the study of French literature; excluded are automatic translation, production of bibliographies or critical editions, and linguistic studies. Well before the invention of the computer, the importance of close attention to words as a prime aspect of literature had been stressed by Baudelaire, Mallarm\u00e9, and Val\u00e9ry, who thus indirectly justified the several types of computer-aided studies now being done. Of these, word indexes can be useful only if the original work was poetry written in lines of fixed length. Grammatical concordances (which distinguish homographs and gather together inflected forms under one heading) have so far been produced only mechanographically; development of computer processes to produce these research tools is well advanced. The computerized alphabetical concordances, in spite of minor difficulties, are eminently usable. While it is difficult to know to what extent indexes and concordances have been used for the study of French literature, one such study, a traditional approach to Baudelaire, was facilitated and made more accurate through the use of a word index. Other possibilities, for example, the study of the evocative effect of sound patterns in poetry, are opened up by programs that transcribe poetry into phonetic symbols. use of computers has shed valuable light on authorship of anonymous articles in theEncyclop\u00e9die and has provided a clearer understanding of the techniques proper to oral literature. Unsuccessful computer-aided studies of French literature seem to fail because of insufficient sophistication in the approach to literature. Thus, it would seem that in the partnership between the literary man and the computer man, the literary man should be the dominant party.","qualityIndicators":{"pdfVersion":1.3,"abstractCharCount":1804,"pdfPageCount":12,"tdmReady":false,"teiSource":"pub2tei","xmlStats":{"imageCount":0,"refCount":0,"sectionCount":1,"sectionLevels":[{"sectionCount":1,"level":0}],"tableCount":0,"sectionDepth":1,"paragraphCount":1},"score":8,"pdfPageSize":"404.64 x 630 pts","refBibsNative":false,"keywordCount":0,"pdfWordCount":5490,"pdfWordsPerPage":458,"pdfCharCount":30234,"abstractWordCount":270,"pdfText":true,"hasStructuredBody":false},"title":"Etat pr\u00e9sent de l'utilisation des ordinateurs pour l'\u00e9tude de la litt\u00e9rature fran\u00e7aise","hasFormula":false,"refBibs":[{"host":{"editor":"l'Illusion Comique de Pierre Corneille","author":[{"name":"Essai Muller"},{"name":"De Statistique Lexicale"}],"publicationDate":"1964"}},{"host":{"editor":"le Vocabulaire du Thddtre de Pierre Corneille","pages":{"last":"38","first":"27"},"author":[{"name":"Etude Muller"},{"name":"De Statistique Lexicale"}],"title":"24\"Normes adopt~es pour l'indexation du texte","publicationDate":"1967"}},{"author":[{"name":"Jack D Street"}],"host":{"volume":"43","pages":{"last":"45","first":"42"},"publisher":"Macmillan","title":"French Review","publicationDate":"1929"},"title":"A Statistical Study of the Vocabulary of Chateaubriand's LesAventures du dernier Abencerage"}],"genre":["article"],"host":{"volume":"5","pages":{"last":"154","first":"143"},"issn":["0010-4817"],"issue":"3","subject":[{"value":"Computer Science, general"},{"value":"Computational Linguistics"},{"value":"Linguistics (general)"},{"value":"Languages and Literature"}],"journalId":["10579"],"genre":["journal"],"language":["unknown"],"eissn":["1572-8412"],"title":"Computers and the Humanities","publicationDate":"1971","copyrightDate":"1971"},"ark":["ark:/67375/1BB-VMV7XZKX-H"],"categories":{"wos":[],"scienceMetrix":["1 -
